name: Gage Park
address: 635 SW Gage Blvd, Topeka, KS 66606, USA
reviews: I visit Gage Park often. There are paved walking trails perfect for mommy n me  with strollers, seniors, and dog walkers. Beautiful flower gardens in the spring through winter make for a photographer's dream. The antique merry-go-round is a must see and the train is every child's desire. The dog park is a safe place with separate areas for large and small dogs.

I grew up in Topeka and have always loved this park. I love how they have kept the cool old stone play area, but have also added new fun things. We love to stop by the park when we visit. My kids love it too.
Lots of renovation here. In spring the flowers and trees are beautiful. This is s great place for photography. The zoo is improving and we always LOVE the little train.

The greatest park I've ever been to,  to include major metropolitan parks.   Great playgrounds,  great facilities, beautiful.   The mini train was a big part of my childhood when I visited here as a child,  now its my daughter's favourite thing.
Great place. Lots to do and see. The zoo there is great for it's size.a great stop when you are in Topeka

name: Kansas Children's Discovery Center
address: 4400 SW 10th Ave, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: This Grandma recommends it! Our grandson's birthday party was fantastic. They have an excellent events room you can rent and it includes admission for all of your party guests. There were so many activities - indoors and out -  for ALL of the kids - big and small. We had children 1 thru 12 with us. Plus, the adults had just as much fun discovering as the kids.
A lot of fun STEM activities for the kids! Great staff! A cool place to spend time with your entire family!
Great place to go for the kiddos year round, they usually have updated areas. 100 bucks gets a family 1 year of access. They have indoor and out door play areas. Great for all weather conditions.

Absolutely love this place. We are there a couple times a month and always have to pull the kids away. Got a membership and just drop in or used it as a pit stop while one of us goes to the grocery store.
Great place to take the family you can also get a free day pass if you have a Topeka library card you just have to go to the library and check it out

name: Kansas State Capitol Visitor Center
address: SW 8th & SW Van Buren, Topeka, KS 66612, USA
reviews:
We went on a Saturday so there were few visitors, which was great. We took the Historical tour, which I recommend. Our guide was knowledgeable and shared many facts and anecdotes which made our visit exponentially more interesting than if we just wandered around. It was basically a private your. Two of our friends joined my husband and me for the tour and there was only one additional couple in our group.

I buried the lead because the Capitol is quite beautiful. The renovation was done very well and the visitor center is a wonderful addition.

We parked in the underground garage, and again since it was Saturday it wasn't  crowded. 

My husband and his friend took the tour to the top of the dome. They enjoyed it. I am glad we visited the Capitol building. If you are a Kansan and haven't been,  I recommend adding it to your  "to-do" list.

Absolutely beautiful building that's almost entirely accessible at all times. There's a wonderful new visitors center with lots of displayed history that you can walk through before entering the main atrium. You can wander to all the buildings floors and get awesome views from up near the dome to the floor looking up. As a Kansans it's a great place to visit and see where everything happens.

Great place to spend an afternoon in any season. Have time to plan ahead, call and set up a guided dome tour. Clean facility and well-organized exhibits. Knowledgeable and helpful personnel. Gift and curios. Free to the public.  *Conference rooms can be reserved for a variety of social events.*

The Kansas State Capitol, known also as the Kansas Statehouse, is the building housing the executive and legislative branches of government for the U.S. state of Kansas. Located in the city of Topeka, which has served as the capital of Kansas since the territory became a state in 1861, the building is the second to serve as the Kansas Capitol.
The dome, at 304 ft (93 m), is taller than the 288 ft (88 m) United States Capitol dome, although its diameter (50 ft (15 m)) is approximately half that of the national capitol (96 ft (29 m)). It is one of the few capitols in the United States that continue to offer tours that go to the top of the dome. Visitors enter the dome by climbing 296 steps leading from the fifth floor to the top.

Had the opportunity to visit when I was a senior in high school. I knew I would come back some day. Manifestation at its finest when I earned the opportunity to work on Capitol Hill as an adult. Tour guides are excellent. Such a great way to learn more about our nation. A must do when in DC!

name: Evel Knievel Museum
address: 2047 SW Topeka Blvd, Topeka, KS 66612, USA
reviews: Great detail lots of good contributions from Robby's life and experiences. The Topeka Harley shop and restoration team did an amazing job. The mack is worth seeing and I appreciated seeing the hand painted work on truck and trailer.  You donxt see hand painted vehicle work much any more. Amazing!  Check out the simulator.
More than you ever wanted to know about this incredible person. You probably only heard snippets about him growing up. Get the whole story and learn the behind-the-scenes realities here.
Loved the place. Grew up watching all his jumps. Was amazing to see all these items he used throughout his life and career

Change your website hours!! Today (Sunday) I was traveling through the area and seen a billboard sign for the Museum, Cool! I am a huge E.K fan.
So I google it and it says open today closes at 5:00 great it is 1:00 I get off the freeway and go to the location, locked up tighter than a jail cell.
Can you change the Google sites to reflect the CORRECT hours ?

It’s super interesting to see all the crazy stuff they have. I spent about an hour in there just exploring, Definitely recommend the 4d flying experience. All in all it was a great stop and the gift shop is pretty cool too.

name: Ted Ensley gardens
address: 3650 SE West Edge Rd, Topeka, KS 66605, USA
reviews: This is a gem to visit. We happened to drive by on our way back to Kansas City and wanted to pull over to eat a meal we bought. We found a picnic table by the edge of the pond. Then we decided to take a quick walk around the garden which turned out to be most amazing manicured sanctuary. We loved the paths or trails, the abundance of flora and water falls. The back drop of the lake was very relaxing to enjoy an afternoon.

Beautiful gardens and walking paths. I take my dogs here whenever I can. We walk near the lake, watch the boats, watch the people fishing. There are ball diamonds and soccer fields nearby, pic nic places and playgrounds. A must see for the whole family.

Beautiful place to take a leisurely stroll, stop and smell the flowers, have a date, read a book, or sit and relax/meditate. You could even have a lovely photo shoot or possibly a small wedding! It was a great spot to just be able to relax and enjoy the scenery. My kids absolutely loved it even though one of them wasn't too excited about going in the beginning. By the time we left, he said he really enjoyed it and can't wait to come again, especially when the tulips will be in bloom!

The most beautiful spot in Topeka! The gardens are always maintained and the lake is clean and beautiful. We even had our wedding reception there. Everyone couldn't stop talking about how beautiful the gardens are. It was so lovely and we are so thankful that this place exists. Everyone should come here and stop to smell the flowers.

We are from another city but decided to take family photos in the park. We were pleasantly surprised by the landscaping and appearance. This made for beautiful photos and a very fun family day. The views of the lake from the park are nice and many people seem to enjoy the flowers, ponds, and trails that permeate the park.

name: Lake Shawnee
address: 3137 SE 29th St, Topeka, KS 66605, USA
reviews: This is my go to sidewalk, jogging spot. You have plenty of space on the sidewalk, and your miles are marked as go. At first I was not pleased with the feeding the geese ban, but the sidewalks sure have been cleaner and you see less dead fish IMO. I like that you can jog the entire sidewalk trail and see people. It’s open and has very few blind spots if any. I feel safe when I’m jogging at Lake Shawnee.

The park is nice...ball diamonds.. great walking ...went to look for a place to trout fish in the morning... good luck with that !!! Weeds...weeds ..& weeds....they need to do something with the water condition.... wish I could get a refund on my permit....I'm not going!!!

Lake Shawnee is a great little man made lake on the SE side of Topeka. It has a concrete sidewalk going around the entire lake. The city/county have made tremendous improvements in the past 20 years! Beautiful gardens to walk through, abundant fishing, walking, biking around the lake, kayak and other rentals, golf,  tennis, sand volleyball,  playgrounds, camping.... the list goes on.

Beautiful in the fall, kind of a hidden gem in Topeka. The lake is nice to boat and swim in. My issue between four and five stars is the rules for boating during the summer are too restrictive for the amount of lake available. I would like to see a better use of the lake. Surrounding the lake are parks, playgrounds, and campgrounds that allow for many hours of enjoyment.

Beautiful neighborhood & the walking path by the lake is immaculate. Gorgeous everywhere... amazing large trees, the lake itself, willow, moss, bridges & architecture, all lovely. I just stopped when driving by and took a 10-minute walk, it is definitely an oasis that is perfect for rejuvenating. My Little Monster enjoyed it's also.

name: Topeka Zoo
address: 635 SW Gage Blvd, Topeka, KS 66606, USA
reviews: The Topeka Zoo is small but mighty!  We love going to see the animals and playing at the “beach”.  They have several events for children and adults all throughout the year.  A learning center, a nice gift shop, a park, a petting zoo, and a little restaurant (who needs to serve french fries).  After the zoo, you can walk right across the street to play at the park, stroll through the rose garden (in season of course), fish in the pond or take a ride on the train or carousel.  Both the Zoo and the Park are wonderful places to take photos also.  I’ve captured some of my very favorite pictures at the zoo.

I love this zoo mainly for its size. You get to see a good variety of animals and dont feel completely dead at the end. I loved the newer building by the lions. It gives you a break from the elements and allows you a few of I think 3 different animals.
This zoo is top notch! Their rain forest is full of very interesting birds. This one in particular will seem to try to dive-bomb unsuspecting visitors! Always an adventure!

Because for a small city zoo, the staff make the most with what they have to work with. Animal care is top notch. The rainforest is amazing. The Zoo Camp each summer is a perennial favorite. My son has been going since he was 5 and still looks forward to it at 12.
My all time favorite Zoo! It's on the smaller side but to me is the perfect size. No big hills to climb with your kiddos. Affordable. Clean. Always seem to be adding new exhibits.

name: Combat Air Museum
address: Topeka Regional Airport, 7016 SE Forbes Ave, Topeka, KS 66619, USA
reviews: If you are going through Topeka it's a must stop.  Where else can you find an f-14 tomcat you can see up close.  There is also a wonderful veteran there named Ralph who can tell you all about the place.  Just go, you won't regret it.

Great place with lots of airplanes.  We had a tour guide all to ourselves.  It was all very interesting and my kids loved it. We will be back.  BTW,  there is also a Kansas NG museum close by as well.

We sooo enjoyed seeing and being able to tour the old airplanes this past weekend!! They are truly amazing. The tour guides were very informative as well! One thing that might have made it a bit more enjoyable would have been some port-a-potties and perhaps a place to buy some cold bottled water at least. But I do realize that money could be a concern. And I look forward to returning when they come back!!
Terrific volunteer staff, and so much to see! Brian and Jon took care to share their knowledge about the organization and hard work needed to have a museum of this quality. Thank you!
Knowledgeable, friendly people in an amazing air museum with very interesting displays.

name: Old Prairie Town at Ward-Meade Historic Site and Botanical Garden
address: 124 NW Fillmore St, Topeka, KS 66606, USA
reviews: The family and I stopped here on a trip out west.  We absolutely loved it!  An 1800's town all laid out for you to walk around in coupled with some nice botanical gardens AND IT'S FREE!!  There is a gift shop and a ice cream soda shop (old school pharmacy) that you can stop at and enjoy some refreshments at.  They have a tour as well but you should check their site for hours.
Loved the tulip festival this year. Beautiful flowers and beautiful preserved cultural things.
A great place to spend some time and the gardens are nice when they are in full bloom.
We had a great time today in the weather was beautiful. She especially enjoyed the petting zoo and the prospecting where she found "gems & sharks teeth"!
I have been there for the first time as it is the time for Tulip festival and it was pretty beautiful. Easy to navigate, spend some time there and see those beautiful flowers and lights.

name: Museum Of Kansas National Guard
address: 125 SE Airport Dr, Topeka, KS 66619, USA
reviews: This is a great donation museum with tons of military history. We loved the tanks outside of the museum. They have an American half track from WW2 and some Russian tanks captured in Desert Storm! Inside the museum has lots of military artifacts from the National Guard including a flame thrower, anti tank gun, rocket launchers, and way too much to list. There was some military gear for the kids to dress up in, which was awesome.

Neat place. No idea it even existed until I drove by it. Lots of aircraft and equipment on display, everything has a descriptive tag on it. Great place for a short walk, see some amazing engineering and to enhance your sense of patriotism.

I Love having my Dad & Mother memorialize with a USAF brick at the Museum. My Father & Mother in Law with a National Guards brick as well. Also, both families with a plaque inside. Donations went to a fabulous cause. ❤❤

We enjoyed it so much we recommend it highly. It's very educational you leave having total respect for all of our military past and present. The people there or very helpful and wonderful they answered your questions or found somebody that can. Very clean we left there knowing a lot more than we did I cannot thank our military enough for what they have endured and still do. All in all it was very educational and a great experience. The hospitality was as best as you can get!!!!! Thank you again
Neat place to visit. All the new additions to the yard crafts.

name: Mulvane Art Museum
address: 1700 SW Jewell Ave, Topeka, KS 66621, USA
reviews: We have enjoyed visiting the art lab many times. Several stations for the kids & kid at heart to get creative.  They host parties as well as open creative area with a station that changes regularly.  Free parking & free admission.  Located in the basement of the Mulvane Art Museum.

This is such a fun place for the kids! My three love going to the art lab. There are so many different hands on art activities that are offered, and for free! They have a Lego area, places to draw self portraits, paint, color, use blocks, weave, draw like you are in a cave, and many more. It is run by the university, and work study students. We have been several times and every time has been a great experience.
I love the art lab down in the basement. My kiddos enjoyed getting to be creative.
Very nice place to visit and learn. I enjoyed it and will be back.
Wonderfully curated. Can't wait for the next installation.

name: Great Overland Station
address: 701 N Kansas Ave, Topeka, KS 66608, USA
reviews: The history was was interesting.  My friend left this very station 65 years ago.  We were here for a Harvey Girl Luncheon.  The meal was terrific and service was divine.
Closed on Mondays, but has what appears to be a great museum place and a lot of outdoor walking areas
This is a wonderful place. Play room for children. Lots of information and beautiful building.
Wonderful place to see a great amount of kansas history and talk to some very intelligent people.

I was not inside the station, just outside, on the lawn near the tracks just like everyone else.  I can't believe they let pedestrians cross the tracks!  Unsafe.  

We were there for the UP 844 steam train and it was really cool.

name: Ward-Meade Park
address: 124 NW Fillmore St, Topeka, KS 66606, USA
reviews: Very nice and relaxing place to come and see the beautiful light displays at night. I especially love the Asian garden display with the meditation bell. Reminds me of my old martial arts training facilities when everyone was outside doing various exercises and meditation. I was honestly expecting to see a group of students jogging by with their sparring sticks.
The landscaping is absolutely stunning. A great place to relax and unwind.
Ward-Meade Park is beautiful I love to go there and just walk and clear my mind
Beautiful and peaceful place. Tulips were just blooming. Just Beautiful!
A variety of garden themes, the Japanese garden is excellent, but there isn't a bad one in the bunch. Plenty of shade, two free parking lots, you won't be sorry.

name: Kansas Museum of History
address: 6425 SW 6th Ave, Topeka, KS 66615, USA
reviews: Beautiful museum with a great children's hands on learning area. Staff very knowledgeable, friendly and approachable. The walk on train experience was my favorite, but the Native American history was the most interesting to me. The gift shop had lovely Kansas items for friends and family.

We were so surprised how wonderful is this museum!! It is clean, bright, open-feeling with very informative displays. The number of displays will have you there from 2-4 hours depending on how much time you take at each stop. 
Loved it!!

Beautifully set up and was very impressed by all the artifacts and the history that went with it...It still looked the same as it did back when I first saw it back in 1985😊😊😊 Great place for  our of towners or locals to visit.. I think the three of us spent at least 4 hrs. going through the museum,and found it utterly amusing!
Very interesting place, yet really fun to walk around for both kids and adults. Staff is super friendly.
Nice variety of Kansas related exhibits from early times, settler times, to the present. Restored train and passenger cars was a special treat for our toddler.

name: Jayhawk Theatre
address: 720 SW Jackson St, Topeka, KS 66603, USA
reviews: It is such a beautiful building!  The embellishments and attention to detail with so much still original!  If you love old buildings it is a must see.  My only complaint is that it was cold.  The old theater seats are long gone so the event planners used folding chairs and there were a few tables.  I know that it is a work in progress and will only get better, I'll happily go again!

The architecture of this place is Way Cool the Ambiance and Acoustics are just as awesome. Seems to lend itself better for Electronica and music type Productions rather than theatrical events however it's fun no matter what and in a great location

My work had a little gathering there. The employees are awesome! The food was good. The atmosphere was was great. I love old historic places and they offered to take anyone who wanted on a tour. Loved it!
Still pretty rustic,  but the show was great. Be prepared as like in dress appropriate to the outdoor conditions.  The existing HVAC is also rustic.
The last surviving historic theater in town - someday it'll be beautiful again.

name: Burnett's Mound
address: 3511 SW Skyline Pkwy, Topeka, KS 66614, USA
reviews: This Topeka overlook has always been popular. What has changed is that now you can't drive to the top anymore. You have to park then walk about a mile to get there. You can also ride a bike to the top provided you have very strong legs. I do have to say it's more peaceful without all the cars.
Great place for a hike.  Awesome view.  Our dogs love it too.
Great view high above the City of Topeka.  Nice walk up to the top.

The Powers that be Decided on their own without the Public's input to put a MASSIVE STEEL GATE at the top. So, you can no longer drive to the top and sit and enjoy OUR PARK and a STATE HISTORICAL SITE. THIS WAS VERY SNEAKY and done like a communist government.. This should not be allowed to stand. This WAS the best site and View in TOPEKA, It still could be if we demand it back !!  Please start contacting city officials.

Lovely view, I used to take my daughters up there a lot.  There used to be a short trail at the bottom of it that didn't take long to get to the top.     Lately the ground hasn't been kept up with and it's no longer there.   We don't have enough time together to go the long way.  But it's very beautiful once you're up there. I'm surprised there's not many ppl there all the time.    Could use more upkeep  It's a chigger and snake sanctuary at the moment

name: Holley Museum-Military History
address: 420 SE 6th Ave, Topeka, KS 66607, USA
reviews: This is a small museum from a personal collection located in the Ramada Hotel, but don't let that fool you.  The space here is larger than expected and seems to keep pouring over with artifacts and model scenes.  You could easily spend an hour to three or more going through this museum and the best part about it is the old veteran who usually sits in there and watches over this vast collection.  If you get a chance then check it out and ask the old veteran to show you around.  He is full of information and stories to tell.  A true treat for anyone interested in history and meeting a nice gentleman.
A awesome place of military history along with just American history. Great place to see if you have a chance!

My guide was a wealth of knowledge! An amazing place full of fascinating stories. Wish I could have spent more time here.  And free! It's inside the Ramada Inn facility, and I'm told it's one of two free museums in the building.
Great museum. Make sure to go when the volunteers are there for some great stories.

name: Iliff Commons
address: NE 31st St, Topeka, KS 66617, USA
reviews: This is a lovely place to walk (or run).  There is also a mountain biking trail. There are a variety of features along the trail such as statues of bison at the top of the Ad astera ascent where you can see the city of Topeka on the horizon, a replica cabin of the one the founders of Topeka spent a cold winter in until it burned, a tree fort you can climb up into, a pond with a dock, and a large tire swing. If I had grandkids I would definitely bring them.  My husband and I visited in March when the grasses were brown. It was still beautiful, but I'd love to go back in spring or early summer.
A wide range of terrain and very well taken care of trails. The runner signs, the cabin, the bison and the pond are all great features.
Very nice of the Iliff family to open their land to the public. Very enjoyable, thanks! Be sure and read the rules posted at the entrance, very humorous and helpful.
Beautiful. Very well kept. I love that i don't have to use a leash. Nearly everyone is very friendly.
Outstanding place to walk. Hills are demanding, but short. Short drive and scenic views. So many thanks to the Iliff family.

name: Dornwood Park
address: 2815 SE 25th St, Topeka, KS 66605, USA
reviews: Love the twists and turns, had very zen feel for me. Can't wait to make the time to go back. Honestly stumbled across this place and glad I did.

I have spent nearly a year on these trails with my dog and I must admit these are some of the best trails I have ever hiked around this area of Kansas and this is coming from a country boy that has spent most of his life exploring nature. 

     Dornwood trails and park are just a short drive from the south east side of Topeka which is filled with all the stores and restaurants one needs. Don't let the location fool you, I can tell a lot of care and attention has been given to them.

     I look forward to experiencing them more on my journey to a healthier body and mind. 

    One of the best kept secrets of southeast Topeka.

I was pleasantly surprised by the spray park they added to the park. I had no idea they had that amenity there. That's awesome for the kids who may not be able to afford to go to the community pools. I hosted a birthday party there and the park was clean and grass was cut. The playground equipment was in great condition and appeared newer than in most parks. I'm still shocked that something this nice is over here and grateful at the same time. It definitely didn't look this amazing when I was growing up! Way to go Topeka!
Color marked trails. The landscape has changed a lot since we roamed through a few decades ago, but the mystique remains.
Lots of trails to run, walk or ride a bike... ps don't get lost. Lol

name: Felker Park
address: Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: Great view of the sunset on a clear day. Like to come here to walk the dogs and take the trails towards the back of the field near the tree line.
Love the parks and recreation girl named Gina. Shes so hot and very friendly
Peaceful... sounds of people enjoying their recreation at the tennis courts and people taking their dogs out for a nice walk or run.  I enjoyed my time there.
Ample parking with a nice walking trail near by. You will generally see some kind of wildlife along the way.
Football soccer fields not wheelchair accessible

name: Hummer Sports Park
address: 2751 SW East Circle Dr S #1, Topeka, KS 66606, USA
reviews: The folks volunteering at concessions are fantastic but they could use more support. They also need a band only line during the break those kids get during the 3 quarter of football games. The sound system could use some more power at the low end and roll off some of the mids causing a lot of distortion.

This is a great and roomy football stadium with plenty of room to entertain bored little ones while your big kids are playing their football games.  The food is not bad at all.  Additionally, you are able to follow the teams up and down the field from the bleachers.  They are nice and roomy.  So you can get a great vantage point and videos/photos through out the game.
Great place to run!
Just a beautiful and peaceful park!
Clean and good ballpark food

name: Mouse Trap Skate Park
address: 801 NE Poplar St, Topeka, KS 66616, USA
reviews: Well kept clean park.  Kids love the old school play area along with the new jungle gym style.  The trails are a great walk.  The trees are beautiful.

Great park and such a good place to skate.
Loved it.
Skater for life🤘
I hadn't been up towards the Oakland Community area in a long time. It is a heck of a lot cleaner and better maintained, and the teens were nice and respectful. Proud of you Oakland!
I just stop by for a min n OMG THE BENCH broke the moment I sat on it 😡....be careful
I like the park but I can tell it wasn't designed by a pro skater. Fun to skate though. I liked it. Skate there if you got time!!

name: MacLennan Park Trail
address: Topeka, KS 66606, USA
reviews: A very beautiful park with forest trails and water bodies
We love walking our 2 dogs. There's plenty of trails to always keep it interesting.
Great hiking trails but take a picture of the map kiosk before hiking. We toke a picture and used it several times at trail junctions. Beautiful timber with many species.
Beautiful nature..
Love this place. It was the first time and was snowing.

name: Charles Curtis House Museum
address: 1101 SW Topeka Blvd, Topeka, KS 66612, USA
reviews: Interesting to see 😃
Beautiful house rich in history.
Worth the tour!!
Fascinating artifacts and period furnishings related to Topeka's most prominent statesman.

name: World's Largest Wren Statue
address: 466-498 SW Huntoon St, Topeka, KS 66612, USA
reviews: As an avid fan for quirky roadside attractions this is definately a huge bird! It's a bit sun faded sits prominently in a little grass park between busy streets. There is a pull off spot to park so you can get up close to view it. My 4 star rating is the lack of info plaque. There is some info online but the statue sits with no credit to the artist or explaination.
A tranquil little park in the middle of the hustle and bustle of city life.
Located right near downtown is this cute little roadside attraction that’s has been there longer than I bee alive!
Big bird, can't complain.

Probably not a lot of people interested in this statue although it has historical significance to Topeka. We were here to take my Mothers picture with the statue like she had done in 1950. Close to Kansas Capitol Bldg. Another point of interest.

name: Historic John and Mary Jane Ritchie house
address: 1116 SE Madison St, Topeka, KS 66601, USA
reviews: If the description of how Lyme is made doesn’t entertain you, maybe the racist tour guide will! The tour guide referred to a slave as “it”, and talked more about how to manufacture concrete in a quarry and the Congregationalist church than the Underground Railroad. He had historically inaccurate information about Native Americans and called them “primitive people.” Please don’t come here, it would be a better use of your time to read the Wikipedia article. Or go to the Brown v. Board Historical site down the street, that’s an amazing way to learn about the history of segregation and slavery. It was mostly the guide we had, he was the only one there and he may not have been the regular guide, but our group was severely disappointed in the quality of this experience.
Wow! Awesome stop along The Kansas African American History Trail!
I dont know wat the house is an never heard of it......so plz let me know
I just walk passed it to get home. I don't know much about it
The guide is very knowledgeable and makes leaning about the underground railroad interesting.   I would go back

name: Perry State Park
address: 5441 W Lake Rd, Ozawkie, KS 66070, USA
reviews: Great trails for mountain biking, hiking and running. Lots of spiders and ticks in summer
A refreshing water venue that can easily be made into a day trip from points in and around Greater Kansas City. A breath of fresh air.
It was by chance wé stayed here. Beautiful place with lots of history.
A bit windy but otherwise, a great day.
Peace, camping fishing, Muligans place to eat..its gteat

name: Historic Lecompton
address: 640 E Woodson Ave, Lecompton, KS 66050, USA
reviews: All Kansans need visit Lecompton. The history of our state before it was a state is intriguing and so well presented at the museum in Lecompton. 🌻

My wife and I visited here for the annual Christmas tree displays. We will be returning. 150 Christmas trees with lights and ornaments from a large number of different times. Just an incredible number of displays. The nostalgia was incredibly moving for me.

Staff is friendly and helpful. Entry is by donation so very affordable for young or elderly families wanting some fun without a ton of money. Space is tight and there was a good number of people so be prepared to take some time and be patient. The building was built in the early 20th century and with all the exhibits it can be hard to move around at times with all the people there.
Really not much to see for the distance you have to travel. They were having a street fair with a few vendors. The church had a scrumptious chicken dinner. There is a cafe there.
Wonderful place! Loved the history & 202 Christmas trees. Highly recommended!

Nice free history site that has little known importance.  Turn right(north?) When u get done with toll booth.  There is no sign telling u to turn right or left.   I was coming from the east on highway.

name: Prairie Band Casino & Resort
address: 12305 150th Rd, Mayetta, KS 66509, USA
reviews: We always have a good time here. The attendants are on top of keeping everything picked up and clean, even security can be spotted pushing empty chairs in closer to the machines to keep them out of the walkway. Saw and heard a number of people winning. Highly recommend going here!
Beautiful location. A wonderful get a way stay.  The buffet was the best food I ever had. Puts Kansas city casinos buffets to shame. Nice rooms a bit dated, but our room was clean and comfortable.

Last night. Was a blast!!! Not jammed packed, yet enough guests to make the evening delightful. Great selection of slots, and now there is a "High Limit" room.  Sweet selection of table games. Not one was closed, and all the tables had guests playing. Definitely going again!

Don’t go there if you are a pretty single female. Especially if you came from an event and are dressed up. Security will ask about you when you leave. I was just trying to gamble. It is not my fault if men come up to me, I never went up to anyone. So why are you going up to my friends and asking about me?

The rooms are fairly nice but the casino was disappointing. They've done all the expansion and renovation but so many of the games look alike. They're either retro-old (which I still like) or they all have dragons or some other Oriental theme. They just play and look the same and there was a lot of grumbling about how tight they are. We will probably check it out again after the new additions but I hope they've got some more different games. I did enjoy the hot tub area being open all night.

name: Breakout Lawrence
address: 727 Massachusetts St, Lawrence, KS 66044, USA
reviews: We went in completely green, having never played a breakout room.  We did the "Rules of Basketball"  The staff was very pleasant and helpful.  The room was great.  We used all 3 hints and received a few extra "bonus" hints at well timed points.  These were never annoyingly too revealing - just enough to nudge us in the right direction.  We will be back!
So much fun with a large or small group! Really challenging and each room has new surprises so you really must do them all👍🏼😉

Had a great time in the Civil War experience!  Would recommend it to any group of 2 or more people 13 years old and older unless there was a younger person who really like older things and was at least 5 feet tall.  Helpful to have 2 or more people with different thinking styles like visual vs verbal and sequential vs random.  A lot of fun.  Nothing threatening about it at all.  Very helpful staff.

We had a great time! The Civil War room was very creative and challenging. The staff were super friendly and helpful during our time. This was our first breakout and definitely not our last!  Highly recommended!

After having broken out of all the rooms, for a family holiday event we tried the mobile breakout room that comes to your house: it was great. So convenient to have the breakout room come to you. They set it up in a room in your home. The breakout features were clever and had twists you might not expect for something brought in. Great fun at a great price.

name: Shawnee County Parks + Rec
address: 3137 SE 29th St, Topeka, KS 66605, USA
reviews: Awesome place to go and fish and picnic ride bicycles will be back
Very Clean. I Was Able To Relax And Meditate.
It's Beautiful !!
Nice, inexpensive camp ground.  No sewer hook ups but dump station is just across the street.  Along side beautiful Lake Shawnee.

I signed my teams of for the Lake League long story short they canceled the league not enough teams (which they knew this and said nothing before taking my kids money) and here OT is almost a month later and Im still waiting for them to return my kids 2300.00 which they gave me the run around told me I couldn't pick it up only to find two weeks later I can pick it up. The lady of accounting needs to be fired how are we not insuring $2300.00 or we are sending large amounts with a tracking number Shawnee county park and rec needs to be shut down or they need new people running it SCGSA as well!

name: Watkins Museum of History
address: 1047 Massachusetts St, Lawrence, KS 66044, USA
reviews: Cute, FREE, museum right on mass! Definitely worth stepping in and taking a look. Their kid programs in the summer are a wonderful escape from the heat and don't forget to take the little ones to the top floor to visit the playhouse. Reserved free parking for museum guests in the alley behind the building, handicap entrance on the side.

This museum has a ton of artifacts and information about the history of Lawrence, Kansas. It includes everything from the civil war to civil rights. It has a lot of displays about University of Kansas basketball. It also has stuff about wheelchair basketball. It has displays about the raid on Lawrence by Quantrail and his raiders. It also has a display about John Brown, the famous abolitionist.
Great collection and good layout. Not too big. BEAUTIFUL building!
Nice museum. Good local history exhibits. Nice old building. Friendly staff. They offer a wide range of family friendly activities. Great place to learn about Lawrence!
Great place for a family.  They have interactive displays aa well!

name: Riverside ATV Park
address: Topeka, KS 66616, USA
reviews: Is an exelant place to ride and is kid friendly. I've been riding there for years and now take my kid's there as well.
Super sloppy right now but when it's dry a really fun place to ride. Would give it 5 stars but it's not in the best neighborhood. Alot of sketchy people walking around
A buddy and I went on April 6th and it was perfect, there were so many jumps and trails to hit. This place is perfect for quads and dirtbikes
Great place to ride atv, dirt bikes and even side by sides!!

has good size parking that is before the riding trails. the trails are good size with jumps and mud pits when it has rained. some paths are wider than others but has multiple track paths  to ride on that are located in the woods. this is the coolest atv park we have seen.

name: Betty Phillips Park
address: 3303 SE Irvingham St, Topeka, KS 66605, USA
reviews: Very large, plenty of room for everyone, quiet and peaceful.

The park had broken glass on the play ground bolts sticking out the picknick table as area and opened water cover in the grass by freemont and irvingham besides these few things and they mowed over the pop cans and left sharp metal pieces in grass buttt the park is fun to play in
Okay park needs better up keep tho.
Great playground and a nice walking trail

I live across the street.  I love to see the kids play on the equipment and on the court.  Usually clean,  use to be a high crime area but police presence is frequent and things are changing for the better.  Great for walking, dogs should be on a leash. I would like for there to be better lighting and restrooms.

name: KU Natural History Museum--Dyche Hall
address: 1345 Jayhawk Blvd, Lawrence, KS 66045, USA
reviews: This museum has SOMETHING FOR EVERYONE! I thoroughly enjoyed the reptile and bug exhibits, as well as the dinosaur exhibit and large array of taxidermy.

It's a fun visit, but mostly the same exhibits with few updates. Suggested contribution was $7, but since it's a college campus, I don't know what the money supports. The taxidermy is falling apart, and the mural behind them is faded. Love the fossils in the basement.
Love it here! I remember coming as a child and it's still excite me

Great collection,  extremely clean, friendly staff!   Much more rare pieces than you'd expect from such a nondescript museum on a college campus.   My fiance and I had a great time and my four year old daughter was engaged and fascinated for our whole 3 hours through the museum!
Awesome museum

name: Spencer Museum of Art
address: 1301 Mississippi St, Lawrence, KS 66045, USA
reviews: Excellent Art Museum with wonderful art!! A great variety ranging from old canvas paintings to more modern forms of visual art👌 I highly recommend checking out Spencer to anyone that appreciates art. Llet me not forget the delightful staff! Thank you for the experience!

Amazing art museum! Some of the best curated exhibits I've seen in terms of getting you to think deeply about what you're looking at, the context in which you're looking at it, how it relates to other objects, etc. Just really top notch. Made for a very memorable date night.

A great art museum! Very educational - this Art Museum understands that's art should be experienced, but also put in perspective for those who don't I know much about it. There temporary exhibits are always very interesting. Always a stop when I'm in the Lawrence area.
Excellent museum with a wide variety of exhibits to suit any taste. Parking right across the street and very inexpensive. Museum is free and open to the public.

For a university museum, and the fact that the main gallery is free to visit, this is a must see. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly, and parking was free. I was surprised by the broad spectrum of art here. Plenty of contemporary pieces, various American pastoral works, 18th century European portraits, and a hodge-podge of Buddhist/Asian religious statues. Too must to list. It's not an extensive collection, but certainly a surprise.

name: The Lessman Farm & Truckhenge
address: 4124 NE Brier Rd, Topeka, KS 66616, USA
reviews: The owner took us around and gave us a tour that lasted over an hour. Both him and his wife were very gracious and full of information. They do not charge but take donations. We were really glad we stopped here. It was interesting.

Just so happened to stop by on the best weekend of the year and was able to meet Mr. And Mrs. Lessman and their son. They were so gracious to have the land wide open for us to explore. It is so much more than truckhenge. There is also boathenge, knarlwood people, bottle walls, fairy gardens, lost soles forest, and a quarry with beach views.

A cool spot. Had to follow the signs to get in the right spot. Wasn't really sure that it was okay for me to be there, so I pulled up and hollered. The owner cam out and gave me his spiel, then directions to the henge. Drove around the area and found the boat and truckhenge, which were really cool. 

Honestly, it's probably a 4 star due to how chaotic the area is, but you should see it before it's gone. Time doesn't stop for anyone.
Its a little piece of heaven on this earth. U can go n clear ur mind there

Wow. Not sure how to describe this place. The artist and owner, Ron, is just as interesting as his art and property. If you stop by, make sure to get a tour from Ron. There's more to see than just the trucks and Ron can tell you all about it!

name: Topeka Performing Arts Center
address: 214 SE 8th Ave, Topeka, KS 66603, USA
reviews:
It's a really nice venue for a concert. The facility is clean and well maintained. The seats are nice comfortable padded seats and there isn't a bad seat in the house. The acoustics are pretty good as well. 

The only draw back I. could see was the concession stands could be updated to serve customers faster. 

I would definitely would definitely go see another concert at the Topeka Performing Arts Center.

Very retro! We had seats that had said we may have some limited viewing or objects in the way of stage or something to that effect. Anyway, when we arrived, the ushers found us and others better seating, so our seats ended up being great! The ushers were all very kind and helpful. The whole experience was great! Really loved the venue, being an older, real retro locale!

Chocolate Nutcracker was absolutely fantablous!!! I was really entertained.. Put together very well... Very nice people... Love the Chocolates After show!!   Mr. Steve awesome sauce.. Great show awesome job!!!! The only problem I had was it was freezing cold in the building. I watch with my scarf, gloves and coat on entire show.. Clean and nice place.

Enjoyed the show. But I felt theat more could have been done as far as signage and comfort goes. There weren't many signs to help navigate easily to where I needed to be. So I had to wait through two lines. When I only needed one. Other than that my only other complaint was the seats We rent comfortable. I kept having to adjust around to try to get comfortable. Concessions could have some more variety. I found the selection to be lacking.
Saw Kansas last night! Beautiful venue and the staff was top notch! I’m looking forward to coming back for another show!

name: Black Jack Battlefield
address: 163 E 2000 Rd, Wellsville, KS 66092, USA
reviews: Open air complex. Was just looking for something to do for an hour, fit the bill. Easy access
Wonderful place to adventure with family
Love haveing picnic here
Love blackjack keeping the history  going on for future generations
Beautiful trails and with lots of history

name: Brown v. Board of Education National Historic Site
address: 1515 SE Monroe St, Topeka, KS 66612, USA
reviews: Absolutely fantastic place. So much history and to even walk down these famous halls. Especially being an educator, I put on my teacher lens and thought about all of the children. We spoke to an amazing park ranger named Dexter who met some of these famous individuals in the pictures. Be sure to ask for him. Wonderful place.

I know this is a smaller park so I wasn't expecting much, but I was blown away! The school building itself is beautiful and well restored, the kindergarten classroom is really cool to see how things were when the room was in use, the exhibit rooms were amazing! I teared up walking through and reading some of the information. The exhibits go through the history of segregation, which is horrible, but very interesting to see. The ranger was very kind and accommodating and you could tell she really cared about the site and the information there. This is a fantastic place to visit if you are in the area, and if you aren't in the area it is with going out of your way to visit! Even my small children were interested. The kindergarten room, in addition to being informative, has blocked and other toys that the students would have used that children visiting can play with. The gift shop has lots of interesting books about segregation, Jim Crow, and Brown v. Board.

A good place to pay your respects -- to the never-ending quest for equality for all -- if you're in the neighborhood. The pivotal Brown v. Board of Ed case began here in 1951 at Monroe School, where black students were sent in Topeka’s segregated school system. Monroe, built in 1926, is well cared-for by the National Park Service, with several sober displays in former classrooms, and the auditorium. It’s conventional stuff, but it never hurts to be reminded of how our society got where it is. The staff was friendly and attentive.
March 2020. The museum provides a very clear historical perspective and judiciary timeline without too much technicality. Must see. Loved it.

Learn everything about the historic Brown Vs Board of Education court decision. The place is stroller and toddler friendly. There is a kindergarten room with small desks and toys for kids to play with. You can see most of everything in an hour or less. 
Admission is free. There is a gift shop.

name: Holcom Park Recreation Center
address: 2700 W 27th St, Lawrence, KS 66047, USA
reviews: Man you can enjoy sports,  feel comfortable, and even take a shower if your in a bind.  Clean and a friendly staff.  Great place all around.
Great place for kids to play. Love the climbing tree!

Awesome community resource. Plenty to do inside (bball, racket ball, pool, equipment) be outside (volleyball, bball, bocce ball). We always sign our son up for kids day out when school is out and it's offered.

A fun park! They have a brand new play structure, swings for big and little kids, baseball fields and tennis courts, a covered picnic area with tables, and a recreation center. It is clean and located nicely in a neighborhood.
Love location. Great swings and child playground. Decent BB fields. Original indoor facility not maximized or updated well.

name: Hobbs Park
address: 702 E 11th St, Lawrence, KS 66044, USA
reviews: Not a bad place to just sit and relax for little while
Nice shrooms here

Great park, one of our favorites.  It has a picnic shelter area and bathrooms.  The swings seem too tall but that can be good for teens or adults.  Has a bar on the equipment that adults seem to use for pull ups.
Nice neighborhood park. Wacky,unstoppable Kickball crews,gotra love 'em.
Great history

name: Forest Park
address: 400 N Locust St, Ottawa, KS 66067, USA
reviews:
I love this place! I've been coming to this beautiful park for well over 50 years, and still after all these many years every time I come I find something so beautiful I just want to share it with everyone. Yesterday was no different. From the mighty Oaks to Redwood's, trees of all shapes and sizes and in all different phases of their life span it's all so much beauty to behold! 

The Forrest Park has quite a bit of history too, and from it's creation to now it has been well maintained and kept up in excellence by people who love the beauty it has to offer. And over the past few years they've even added more play equipment for children and a dog park for our furry friends too! So Forrest Park has something for everyone! A great pool, plenty of shelter to picnic in, a Frisbee course, Horse shoe court, baseball field and a paved walking path (have to share with vehicles) and so much beautiful grass to walk in, and lots of beautiful birds as well! check it out for yourself, I think you'll love it as much as I do!

The best park in town. They do a lot of neat events here and the park is good sized. I took one star off because the city pool is here and they always close 1 month early every summer and also close at 6 PM so while the pool is there for residents to enjoy most who work don't get much chance to. I took another 2 stars off because ever since they put in the fenced in off leash area for dogs some people have become confused and let their dogs run around illegally off leash in the rest of the park. This is a huge safety concern as there are often a lot of families with small children about. Every dog is nice and safe until it isn't. Park needs better reinforcement of the dogs and also the motorists who speed. Otherwise the park is great. Love the horse shoe club too.
So much fun for the grandbabies and myself. Lots of updated play equipment! We love this park!
One of the best parks I've been in, each year they improve on something. They even have a Breast feeding and changing tent. I've never seen one in any other park. Great job Ottawa KS.
Such a beautiful and peaceful park. So clean. Once walking trails as well

name: Broken Arrow Park
address: 2800 Louisiana St, Lawrence, KS 66046, USA
reviews: Great place for family. Also you can reserve the North end of the park for events at the Lawrence parks n rec

Spacious, close to schools and accessible to neighboring homes. Softball field, playground and pavilion with electricity for cookouts. I use it a lot to train my pup. And the Grandchildren love the playground.
Brings back wonderful memories. Hasnt changed much over the decades. I'm not sure that it should.

I like this park because it has a lot of open area, good for dogs and other animals. The park is kept in decent shape with all the landscaping and all that, but I believe that the park playgrounds need to be updated.
Loved seeing all the geese.......

name: Deanna Rose Children's Farmstead
address: 13800 Switzer Rd, Overland Park, KS 66221, USA
reviews: The Christmas Light Display was pretty amazing, the viewing is quite a great idea, just pull up, turn off your headlights, and tune in. It's on 5-11pm, so plenty of opportunity to go, and there are quite a few great song selections going with the lights, even star wars, commemorating the final chapter coming out! (The show is in rotation the whole time) And free! I only went for the light show, so I'm afraid I can't comment on the whole place, but judging by this experience, I'd say it's a great place for families to have good, low-key fun.

I stopped by this cute store on my way back from Texas. There were so many items to choose from I wished I could have taken them all. I did happily leave with four items that made wonderful Christmas and everyone wanted to know where they came from!

Not quite a zoo, not quite a amusement park! That's what makes it so perfect, you can get through this place with nearly any time budget you have. People are friendly, it's not over priced and they keep the place neat and tidy. If you ever have a chance to stop by the Overland Park area during the Christmas holidays, you have to do by and see the light show, fantastic!

This place holds so many memories for me and pretty much everyone I know. This is like THE place to go if you have children or just as a date idea it is most definitely the move. It is quite inexpensive to go to, during the week I believe it is free on certain days and on weekends its like $3 a person. Honestly, you do get your bang for your buck and it's a great way to pass a day. Would recommend!
I have been here many times and will go again. It is a very fun place. Very family friendly. Great for  young kids, but fun for all ages. The light display is amazing. I will go again next year.

name: Overland Park Arboretum & Botanical Gardens
address: 8909 W 179th St, Bucyrus, KS 66013, USA
reviews: I have been going to the Arboretum since I was in high school. (I am 42 years old now) We went way back in the day, before it was all that it is now. No paved trails. Just the wood chipped trails, leading through the woods. It was just as tranquil and peaceful then as is it now. To see it now, you wouldn't even know it's the same place. It has definitely expanded and so many different little attractions, which have just added to it beauty and serenity. I love going here, to just walk, listen to music, be surrounded by nature in all of it's glory. It's the best way for me to clear my mind and make sense of the chaos in the world. It is truly so good for my soul. When I leave, I always feel refreshed and more focused with a clearer mind. I can't LOVE this place enough!

Love this hidden gem! The Arboretum team obviously take pride and great care in their work.  The gardens and fountains are lovely especially in June...the Monet Garden is breathtaking...if you have kids, call ahead to see if the trains are running in the Train Garden! There are 4 miles of mulched hiking trails and peaceful, paved pathways throughout the gardens...a lovely cafe with yummy snacks and a gift shop where you can find an array of amazing and unusual gift items. The Arboretum has special events throughout the year that has become annual traditions for many!  As an added bonus, Tuesdays are free!

Annually go for the luminary walk and it has been a fun and enjoyable experience each time. Walk through and see the gnome houses that are different each year then stroll the luminary area, other lights, trains, hay ride, and the beautiful reflections of decorated trees off the lake. Plus being out of main part of metro can see beautiful stars is the sky. Love going. Takes about 2 hours to leisurely walk through while also taking photos. Dress warm depending weather and while majority is a paved path could be small areas (not counting parking area) that depending might be muddy so consider that when choosing footwear when you visit.

Came here for the first time yesterday for their annual luminary walk and I enjoyed it so much. Seeing the lights, gnome houses and hearing the water was so relaxing. They have areas where you can warm up if you happen to be out there on a chilly night like we did. The only thing I’d recommend is for you to wear your most comfortable shoes, bring something hot to drink (they do provide that as well), gloves and/or hand warmers.
One of our favorite places. Free on Tuesdays!! Paths are always clean. Train exhibit is one of our favorites and the nature park is great to climb on!

name: Baker University Wetlands
address: 1365 N 1250 Rd, Lawrence, KS 66046, USA
reviews: Great place to enjoy nature.
A lot of trails and lots of birds to watch and enjoy. A wonderful place to take your kids to explore and have a picnic.
Lots of easily walkable, bikeable, joggable trails.
The best place in Lawrence for nature lovers.

name: Great Wolf Lodge Water Park | Kansas City
address: 10401 Cabela Dr, Kansas City, KS 66111, USA
reviews:
Staff was overly friendly. Rooms were very clean. So many activities for young children. Little bit over priced (if you go on the weekends) but we went in winter so couldn’t use the outdoor water park. They always have discounts online, we paid $100 for a family of 4 including a night in the hotel, 2 day water passes. Kids had an amazing time, you can also bring in your coolers to your hotel
Room which was very convenient. Seen a guy check into his hotel room at 11am instead of 4pm. So if your room is ready early you can get checked in early (which is super cool) unless you go on a weekend then except to be able to check in around 4pm. Will be going back for my sons 2nd birthday party. Kids 2 and under are free & I didn’t know, I paid for 2 kids and was able to get my nephew in without paying for his wrist band because I already included 2 kids when booking online (my son was a year and a half) so I ended up paying for him when he was to get in free. Didn’t get to try their food, brought our own food in. Over all great experience! I never write reviews and I probably won’t ever again but thank you great Wolf Lodge for the amazing experience ☺️

I usually don't write a review unless it's a great experience.  But, let me say this place is wonderful and the people that work here is AMAZING, very helpful and ALWAYS had a smile on their face. We had an awesome  breakfast server named Jordan and he went above and beyond for us, made sure we were taken care of. Needless to say, I will DEFINITELY recommend this place.  Thank you for making this a wonderful experience for my family. But, most of all thank you for making my daughter feel special on her birthday!

We were just getting a drink at the food area and their was a gentleman there. We thought he was customer and told he to go ahead. He happen to be the GM. We had a wonderful conversation with him (Alex). It made our stay that much better. We have been to three Great wolf lodges (Texas, Minnesota and Kansas) and Kansas City is probably our favorite at the moment. You don’t have to carry you tubes up the stair that is huge!!!!! The staff minus one have been wonderful and everyone had a bad day here and there. It has been great!!!

Kids love it. Water park was great. We went midweek so not crowded. Be prepared to spend way more money than hotel rate. And driving Interstate 70 from st Louis was a nighmare both ways in January.  Missouri does not salt much and often shuts down due to accidents.

We had a great time! Kids ages 12 down to 4 loved the water park. Room was good. The lifeguards are very well trained and aggressively scanning every bit of the water. There are two hot tubs to enjoy- the milder one that kids can play in also and the 18+ only one which was hot and quiet. The adult tub is somewhat secluded which is very nice for relaxing but does not allow for overwatch. One thing to keep in mind is that it is hard to see all of the park so plan ahead and setup meeting points with your kids so they know where to go if they panic and can't find you. We stayed two nights and by the end of the full day in the park my 12 year old was getting bored so I think 3 nights would have been too long.  It looks like there might be more to do with mini golf and an outdoor pool that open in warmer weather. 
Overall a great experience!

name: David Traylor Zoo of Emporia
address: 75 Soden Road, Emporia, KS 66801, USA
reviews: It's a beautiful zoo. Several animals and beautiful plants. It's a small zoo but it's free and def worth it

Been there many times before but it was really beautiful today. The plants and flowers were my favorite part. Took grandchildren and niece. They had a lot of fun. The bathrooms were extremely clean. I was impressed with that. Very beautiful place.
Really nice Zoo for a small town.  Worth a look and great for the whole family! Get the camera/phone out for some great pics and selfies!!
Was expecting a few animals and birds but saw so many. The kids loved it...
Nice little zoo. Perfect for a pit stop while traveling.

name: National Agricultural Center
address: 630 N 126th St, Bonner Springs, KS 66012, USA
reviews: This place is amazing. It's quaint, and very family friendly. The staff was very interested in making our trip there wonderful. We even got to take a mini train ride! I would recommend this to anyone looking to get out of the city and have some real family fun!
Ag hall demo gardens n composting was great. I saw in person what their versions of how to compost were and some live examples of different types of grasses.
Just had a blast it a really great time. Great weather and people who were there were really nice. Love all the old cars but mine is the best.

This was a wonderful Museum but if you're not into walking I don't I would recommend getting good shoes there's a lot to see and there's lots of walking around check it out definitely even though it's a little out-of-the-way still Crossing museum to visit.
This museum is a national treasure that is fairly unknown. Anyone interested in Old agricultural equipment or techniques should come here

name: Amelia Earhart Birthplace
address: 223 N Terrace St, Atchison, KS 66002, USA
reviews: Amazing exhibit and so fun to see all the historic collections about her life and adventures. Easy self guided tour. Staff was very knowledgeable about the history of the house.
Great historical events in our backyard. A woman who was a pioneer for all women.

What a fun adventure we had learning about Amelia Earhart and touring her birthplace. We had a wonderful time and we will make the trip out again. Make sure to back a snack or lunch, there is a beautiful bluff that over looks the river.
Beautiful place with a fantastic view over the river. I came to early in the morning so the house was closed unfortunately

Beautiful! Thoroughly enjoyed exploring the exterior of Amelia’s birthplace. What a view they had! The entire block is a piece of history. I was happy to have stopped while on a road trip. Unfortunately they were not open when I arrived, but if I enjoyed the outside as much as I did, you’re  bound to enjoy the inside.

name: Tallgrass Prairie National Preserve
address: 2480B KS-177, Strong City, KS 66869, USA
reviews: This may be one of the last places to experience our Nation's great grassland. It was a very surreal experience to get away from the highway and be surrounded by nothing but nature. Grass, buffalo, a few trees, and you. The silence was deafening. Your voice left your body and was immediately swallowed up by nature. Eerie, beautiful, and totally like nothing else. The buffalo roam the park at will (fences keep them from leaving). They're huge and can be dangerous, and the park personnel (and signs) warn you of this. Be ready to hike on gravel roads. In 20 minutes you'll find out what this part of the country used to look like. The personnel are friendly and helpful. The displays are informative and present more info than you expect from a place like this.

Fantastic place. Take the trail and you will see the bisons if you are lucky. Beautiful animals and the landscape is awesome. Very helpful ranger, Eric Patterson, at the visitor center. This is my favorite place in Kansas so far. A must see if you like nature and animals

Went in mid October for a visit which is probably not the best time of the year as we are moving to fall but very enjoyable.  The visitor center was excellent and the park ranger working there was very knowledgeable and friendly.   We skipped the bison and farm house and went on the fox creek trail along with our dog.   We all had a good time and this six mile hike gave lots of views of different parts of the prairie. Made you really think back to when all the Midwest was prairie.  Definitely worth a visit

Such a wonderful place to visit, I recommend to take the bus tour, that's a good way to see the majority of the park, it's almost of an hour tour inside and more chance to see the buffalos.
The house tours also very nice, and have a nice picnic area outside.
It's recommended to go visit in a few seasons just see the difference between the low grass in the grass

My visit was for a passion of photographing night scenes around the Midwest and I had been here before I believe, but during the day. The preserve is easy to find and fully accessable. Some areas tend to close gates and assume nobody has interests after hours but this one seems open. Parking was apparent and I saw other facilities that would make this a great place to bring a family

name: Donaldson's Jewelers - Home of Dave Horn Jewelry Repair & Design
address: 902 N Kansas Ave, Topeka, KS 66608, USA
reviews: I have worked with Dave multiple times and have included only a few pictures of the work he has done for me. Dave has a passion for his work as a jeweler. I feel an easy trust with him caring for my precious jewelry because of his welcoming demeanor as well as the jewelry related knowledge and experience he emanates.  Most importantly, Dave's attention to absolute detail is phenomenal and incredibly important when working with finite sizes. Whether my jewelry is important to me due to its monetary value, sentimental value or a combination of the two, Dave is able to listen to what I want and create beautiful pieces I will treasure for a lifetime.

This shop carries beautiful jewelry as well as rare stones and designer knives.  The owners are friendly and the shop has a good vibe. Be sure to check out the cool guitar collection on the back wall.

Dave is amazing! He's very honest and approachable. We've been in the store multiple times and he's always willing to talk or explain things. There's a no pressure approach and it's always very welcoming. They also do repairs and custom pieces. I definitely recommend stopping in to look around or even just to say Hi.
Love Dave's work!  Stop by and see what he has or to talk about a custom order!  You won't be disappointed!

Dave has a warm, welcoming, contagious smile and positive attitude for all his customers and potential customers.  He is knowledgeable and eager to sell you exactly that special piece of jewelry you're looking for.  I brought a ring design idea in to him and he created an amazingly beautiful, quality ring that I will be proud to wear the rest of my life.  His store has a comfortable atmosphere and showcases unique and gorgeous items.  Check it out!

name: Wonderscope Children's Museum of Kansas City
address: 5700 King St, Shawnee, KS 66203, USA
reviews:
My kids loved this. There are so many things to do here! We couldnt even get it all done in one day
 Great way to spend a day with your littles and for a great price!

My daughter had a lot of fun here. We stayed here for several hours, trying everything out multiple times. The grocery store and veterinarian were the most fun, probably because they're a little different from anything else we've ever played.

Great place for kids, especially on a cold rainy day. Best suited for kids older than 1 year, as only 1 room was really suitable for my son. Provides many learning opportunities that don't involve technology. There is even a place where you can eat, if you bring a lunch. Price is very reasonable.

Went here today and it was an okay place. The facility is pretty run down, its in a old school house, which was odd at first. The rooms were okay. The water room had a tub with bath toys in it and that was it. The grocery store and ball room was done good though. This is almost and one and done place.

This was our first time visiting Wonderscope and our kids had a great time. There is something for kids of all ages here. My kids really liked the grocery store and water rooms. Great indoor place to go to during the winter.

name: K-State Insect Zoo
address: 1500 Denison Ave, Manhattan, KS 66506, USA
reviews: Nice place to visit. The insects are well maintained. The staff are nice. It takes about an hours to see it all. There are plenty of things to keep all ages interested.
A great place for children and parents alike
Amazing and thrilling! You can even buy baby tarantulas there! A must see!
Most of these creatures are alive

If you like science or insects, this place is fun. It makes a great additional visit when you are already in town for the Sunset Zoo. The staff is knowledgeable and polite. There are lots of interesting exhibits and things for kids to interact with. And around the building is KState's beautiful gardens.

name: Sunset Zoo
address: 2333 Oak St, Manhattan, KS 66502, USA
reviews: This is a smaller zoo located in Manhattan, Kansas. Although there were several exhibits that were not open, it still was a fun three hours. And when you factor in how inexpensive it is at $5.00 (per adult), the Sunset Zoo is an excellent value - could even be described as a hidden gem.

The Sunset zoo while not very big was a fun little find in the area. The zoo was clean, the animals seemed well taken care of and the staff was friendly. We made it through the whole zoo in a little over an hour however, it is priced very well and was enjoyable!! I would recommend any animal lover stop by and check it out. Good family fun!!

Wonderful! I love this zoo. It is small enough that you won't get tired out before you finish but boasts a variety of animals that are well looked after. Staff is always nice and it's affordable. Great for families, there's a playground and they have a bunch of great volunteer and childcare programs, and they do birthday parties. Very very good zoo couldn't be more pleased
Nice little zoo with a lot of shade. The price is affordable and the group rates are well priced.

I have always loved this zoo. And even though I have not been back in years, I always have admired the hard work of the owners and staff to make it a wonderful experience for everyone. Some of my favorite memories of growing up come from going to this zoo with my parents, loved the peacocks 😍 but fell in love with all of the animals.

name: Flint Hills Discovery Center
address: 315 S 3rd St, Manhattan, KS 66502, USA
reviews: I've been here just to visit and I've been here for a wedding as well, it's a great place. For a smaller town, Manhattan's choice to put in a Discovery center was a great one. The best thing about the Discovery center is that they are constantly changing what is being displayed, so every time that you come you learn something new!

This was a fantastic experience for the entire family. The scavenger hunt for my 4 year old helped to keep her focused and interested on the main level exhibit. We watched the Flint Hills film. It was educational and we enjoyed the 4D effects. Upstairs, there are many play areas for little ones to enjoy. The limitless options for hands-on fun for the kids is well worth the visit. All of the staff was friendly and willing to answer any questions we had. My only complaint was the single-ply toilet paper in the restrooms. We did appreciate the foot stools for the kids though.
My friend had a wedding reception here after Christmas! The decor was still up and looked great! This is a truly stunning venue.

We visited the center expecting the typical kids education center experience. What suprised us most was the condition of the displays. Nearly every one of them was in good condition with only one needing some repair. We also enjoyed the amount of information and the way it was presented. They have plenty of facts designed to stand out to the children while still providing much more information for the adults to read as they walk through. At the time we visited, they had a travelling exhibit called "Rainforest Adventure". The kids in the exhibit were definitely on their best behavior but in spite of that, it was still in good condition and very informative. Having the information in the form of a maze was very interesting. Outside of the information and the exhibits, the staff was very helpful without coming across as overbearing or "stuffy". It appears that the facility was either recently built or recently remodeled. In either case, it was very clean and comfortable to visit. If we happen to be in the area we will keep this in mind as a good place to spend some time and gather additional information on the Flint Hills.

Absolutely amazing! The kids area in the second floor was so perfect for our 2.5 year old :D The main exhibits were very educational and relatable since they were all about local science and history. The gardens on the rooftop were icing on the cake :)

name: Heartland Motorsports Park
address: 7530 SW Topeka Blvd, Topeka, KS 66619, USA
reviews: Came here for the NHRA races.  Good facility and would love to come back if I'm ever in the area!
Love attending the NHRA Drag races here every year! Best day of summer!
The people who work all the things going on out at Heartland Park are one of a kind and are always so fun to be around.
Fantastic facility. Great road course racing surface. Always enjoy my time here.
Great motorsports park just need to fix the roads. Always enjoy coming here. Except when we came for country stampede and had to sit outside the gate for hours while it was raining.

name: TimberRidge Adventure Center
address: 12300 S Homestead Ln, Olathe, KS 66061, USA
reviews: Fantastic venue! Didn't even know it existed. We were told it is only available to groups. Had a company picnic here. Tthe shelter and restrooms were immaculate. Close to a pond with canoes, kayaks and pedal boats. Great trails for biking, running or walking. Highly recommended and will be suggesting the location to others.
I love this place!!
This was a great experience for the sixth graders, glad I got to hang out with them! It is a beautiful area.
Very nice park , nice facilities. Clean restrooms

This place is amazing! It will realy bring out the true leader in you. I want to thank Matt for helping me become a better leader. I highly recomend this place. AND MATT HE IS AN AMAZING PERSON AND IS EXTREMELY PROFESSIONAL AD DESERVES A RAISE!

name: Milford Nature Center
address: 3415 Hatchery Dr, Junction City, KS 66441, USA
reviews: We have brought our children and family here for years.  Great way to spend your afternoon.  I highly recommend this beautiful place

There is a fish hatchery, a walking trail, a playground, an indoor center with displays, a few animals, and some dioramas. It is free and fun and educational. Every time I go, I feel like SuperMom, because the kids have fun and they learn and the get excersize from playing and walking.
Today was Eagle Day and man was it amazing!! Up close and lots of information.

Really enjoyed the nature center like I did when visiting 14 years ago.  However, the staff didn't seem very sociable or friendly.  They all seemed to be hiding in their offices.  There were a couple of ladies working at the hatchery & feeding animals but even they didn't talk much.  Guess it's hard to find good help these days.
Great place lots of good things to see. 5 star

name: Rowhouse Restaurant
address: 515 SW Van Buren St, Topeka, KS 66603, USA
reviews: My husband and I have eaten here on two special occasions and have enjoyed it thoroughly. Especially the fact that they use local/organic and in season food to prepare the dishes. Each time we have ordered the chef's tasting menu and it's fun to see what different flavors they put together. The only glitch that I have noticed, so to speak, is they are a little heavy on the salt (for my taste buds) with a few of their dishes. Other than that the whole experience was positive and we will be choosing the Rowhouse to celebrate future occasions.
It was an interesting place. Not super easy to find. It has charm. The food was interesting. Definitely not average. I didn't leave hungry, but next time I'm ordering something else.

My wife and I went here for a date night as a chance to get dressed up and do something different. We were immediately greeted at the door and taken to a table. The experience was very personal and the house is small enough to feel cozy and comfortable. The food was absolutely amazing. From start to finish every piece was outstanding. Definitely worth the trip.

Rowhouse is great! Not only is it an amazing date night spot but lunch is a great and affordable outing. Also they are amazing people at Rowhouse. They do so much to give back to the community. Like Vegan Fest! All the proceeds went to the Mission. Such a fantastic place! Oh! They also are great at catering to people with food allergies! My sister is allergic to soy, wheat, and mustard and Rowhouse is always willing (with joy) to make her dinner safe for her to eat. I cant say it enought they are amazing at Rowhouse.

Rowhouse has an incredible atmosphere and quite a surprise for downtown Topeka.  The lunch menu was excellent with fresh produce and an amazing tomato soup.  It's in an old row home with multiple levels of dining.  Looking forward to hanging out on the patio when spring comes and enjoying listening to a local band.

name: Lonnie Q's BBQ
address: 3150 SE 21st St, Topeka, KS 66607, USA
reviews: Just stopped by to catch a quick bite to eat on our drive back to Omaha and was blown away. Thanks guys for the hospitality and delicious food. Had to catnap in the parking lot I was so full!

Great Food; Great Service! Great Story about the place. Lonnie came to our table and personally told us all about the place. We got the #1 with no bun & all meats. It was an very large place of great food!

Best BBQ in Kansas... I can say that because most KC BBQ is technically in Missouri. The only real downside to Lonnie's is the limited hours open. Even so it is definitely worth it to go for the cheesy potatoes alone. Simple menu, efficient interior design, clean facilities, awesome staff. There is literally nothing to dislike about any Lonnie Q's experience.

Finally made it for dinner on Friday night, tried the turkey in the slaw, which was the last thing on the menu I hadn't sampled. It was amazing, I also had a bit of my dining partners brisket and pork. So good! I haven't had all the BBQ that's to be had in Topeka, but I have a hard time thinking it can get any better in Shawnee County.
Don’t let the line scare you from giving this place a try. TOP 5 BBQ I’VE EVER HAD. Cheesy potatoes are a must! If you step foot in the state of Kansas eat with Lonnie Q.

name: Tuptim Thai Restaurant
address: 220 SW 29th St, Topeka, KS 66611, USA
reviews: We were driving through Topeka, KS and stopped at this place for lunch on Easter, as it was open. We’ve been to Thailand many times, and the food was extremely authentic. The server was the only one in the restaurant due to the holiday, but she still provided amazing and quick service.
