Overall a great experience - definitely get their appetizer sampler and their Tom yum soup, and drunken noodles!!

This is one of the few restaurants in Topeka where we can get really good vegan food. The service is exceptional, acknowledging and helping us with ordering vegan foods. 
I had the crispy vegetable rolls. And we both had entrees with loads of veggies and tofu. The price is reasonable and the food tasty and filling. 
If you are looking for somewhere to eat that has vegan choices and helpful staff in Topeka Tuptim Thai is the place to go.
Delicious food with many options. Great for vegetarians too. Almost any dish can be optioned with tofu.

The service I received at Tuptim Thai was excellent! Since this was my first time here, I ordered the basics: Pad Thai, Tom Kah Guy soup, soft and crispy spring rolls. The crispy spring rolls are out of this world! Honestly, the best I've ever eaten! I wasn't thrilled with the peanut sauce or the sweet and sour sauce for the rolls, however, as they were too thin and were lacking in flavor. The Pad Thai and soup were adequate, but nothing to write home about. I will definitely return to try some of their other dishes.

Went back & had the crispy spring rolls, drunken noodles (mild+) & coconut milk (mild+) soup. All VERY tasty! The crispy spring rolls were too tasty to stop for a picture 😬.

This place is great!! Food is outstanding, and the staff is on point. They're quick to check on you and make sure everything is good. Try the yellow curry, or drunken noodles, you will not be disappointed!!

name: The Wheel Barrel
address: 925 N Kansas Ave, Topeka, KS 66608, USA
reviews: This place has phenomenal food and great local beer. Their homemade beer cheese is only $3 and comes with delicious seasoned kettle chips. Totally worth it! I had the classic grilled cheese with Gouda and mozzarella plus guacamole and my side was sweet potato chips. I can’t wait to go back and eat again. Highly recommend!

Drawn in by a google search for local restaurants. Totally and pleasantly surprised!
Amazing grilled cheeses. Better than mommas. And totally unique.

Wonderful staff. Great variety of sandwiches including a good selection of seasonal sandwiches. Vegetarian options as well. large selection of beers and mixed drinks. The environment  was very warm and cozy. Did not see the patio as it was cold.

First visit was great! Went at lunch time and the service was a little slow but the place was packed, both inside and on the patio. The food was great! Great flavor, interesting combos of cheese, breads, sauces, etc. The tomato bisque soup was delish also! Worth visiting if in Topeka and the NOTO area is neat as well.

Went to the Wheel Barrel on a lark while working in Topeka. Real glad I did. Was with two work colleagues and all of our sandwiches were fire! Will make it a point to go back whenever I'm in Topeka. The hot cider was pleasing and warming on a chilly January day. We shared the Everything Soft Pretzel with Craft Beer Queso which was out of this world. The Not yo Mama's BLT was delicious. Grilled with siracha mayo, crispy bacon and soft brie it was amazing.

name: Bradley's Corner Cafe
address: 844 N Kansas Ave, Topeka, KS 66608, USA
reviews: What a fun corner cafe! Excellent staff were buzzing through the diner this morning when we visited around 10am. It was busy, but there were open tables and we were seated right away.  We got coffee and two huge breakfast for about $20 bucks. The food was great and we ate some of the best biscuits and gravy we’ve ever had! Yum!! We will have to come back to try the pie! It looked delicious as well!!

The food was great and reasonably priced. The service was great. Very friendly waitress.Worth the tip. The food was brought to the table in a timely manner. Nice and quite breakfast with a little country music playing in the background. Relaxing. All around great eating experience.
Good old fashioned diner with affordable menu. Lots of comfort food choices and pies. Our server was helpful and friendly. I will be back for breakfast sometime. This visit it was lunch.

the best cinnamon rolls in Topeka. The quantities of the other breakfast items are huge. The food is always hot and fresh and the servers are very kind and friendly. Love going to Bradley's and will continue to do so.
What a great place. The dining area is small but the wait isn't very long. The food is awesome. They make their own hash browns, buddies, and even pancake mix. Definitely worth a visit.

name: Monsoon Indian Grill
address: 2040 SW Wanamaker Rd #104, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: Outstanding food—too good to stop eating until you're absolutely stuffed! Excellent service, too! (I'm no photographer, but the lamb biryani was delicious!)

Excellent lunch buffet with a great selection of food. We were greeted by friendly faces. I complimented the lights and the ambience of the restaurant. It was a beautiful place.

 One of the hostesses asked if it was our first time. She proceeded to demonstrate a traditional appetizer dish for us. It was very tasty. The service was exceptional. Fresh bread was offered at the table throughout the meal.  It was a great experience.

The place is really clean and never out of any items in their buffet. Ever since i went there the first time, i have never been to any other place whenever i crave some indian delicacy. Being a typical ‘white’ guy, i still don’t find the food too spicy or too strong. Moreover, customer service is excellent and the lady manager there always greets you with a gracious smile and is very helpful. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who want to try something different and don’t want to spend over the top while doing so
Delicious food. Usually Indian restaurants just add cream to get the yummy taste but not this one. Vegetables and spice brings in the authentic flavor.
Delicious Indian food, lots of options and great for vegetarians and omnivores. Buffet is absolutely delicious.

name: The White Linen
address: 112 SW 6th Ave, Topeka, KS 66603, USA
reviews:
White Linen is a completely unexpected jewel in Topeka, central Capital area.
Just outstanding gourmet master chef prepared meals. First class quality ingredients, first class delicious meals, excellent classy ambient, professional and friendly folks. 
Take your love one's for dinner, for anniversary, for engagement, for birthdays or come up with any excuse for dinner out to White Linen.
The special prices of dinner for two at price one is just incredible deal!!
I started with Cream of Tomato soup - very tasty, delicious with pieces of crab and a small crab cake and medley of cucumber.
The main meal was smoked lamb prime amazing taste, beautifully presented, with out of this world wild mushrooms and perfectly done risotto.
For desert, flourless chocolate cake accompanied with French pressed coffee, made it a perfect dinner.
My business partner had the porkchop, marvelously done.
If anything, I would make the flourless chocolate cake a bit less sweet, more dark chocolatey bitter - use less sugar in the recipe.
Please see a few pictures of our meals.

We have been in to dine twice and both experiences were exceptional! Love the location, the atmosphere, the service, the food, the drinks, and the acoustics (so important). 

Seriously, the acoustics...this usually keeps me out of restaurants, but this place is truly comfortable and easy on the senses.

And the food is excellent! The first visit, I had scallops, on the second, I had the salmon. Both were perfectly cooked! The food was so good the first time around that we didn’t even check the menu ahead of time for the second visit - we just thoroughly trusted them and we were not disappointed.

Swank. Upscale. But unpretentious. I can’t wait until our next visit!
We chose The White Linen Chef's table for our daughter's 14th birthday. Great experience and even better food.

Absolutely the best restaurant I’ve ever been to. This place will forever hold a special place in our heart. They went above and beyond to make our marriage proposal perfect. The food was amazing and the chef was personable, professional, talented and passionate about making amazing food. The drinks are some of the best we’ve ever had. The chefs table was such a unique experience. I have nothing but positive things to say about this place. We did relocate out of Kansas but can’t wait to fly out for a special trip and dinner once again. 
Honestly give this place a try. Reasonable price for the quality of food. If this place was in any other town it would be 5 or 10 times the price.
Food and drinks were amazing. Top notch service. Highly recommend this is a date night destination. We will definitely return.

name: North Star
address: 1100 NW 25th St, Topeka, KS 66618, USA
reviews: I don't even know where to start. The atmosphere is amazing. Reminds me of an old speakeasy or a bootleg liquor hideout. The staff is friendly and very well trained. I've eaten here many times and never had a bad meal. Some of the best cuts of steak I've ever had, and always cooked to perfection. The hashbrowns and gravy are a must try.

I have been all around this nation and even the world. This place is classy. Has deep history. The nicest staff and some of the best food I have ever had. I am seriously thinking of bringing my wife and kid here. And they live in Ohio! This is a must come to place if one is in the area. Loved it!

The food was great but our party had a reservation reserved a week in advance and upon arriving they couldnt find our reservation in their system and we ended up having to pull up the email of the reservation confirmation for them to believe us. We ended up having to wait 35 minutes before they decided to pull a few tables together for us to be able to sit down. The waitresses were great considering how busy it was. The restaurant kind of has an older folks type of vibe to me

This place was awesome.  A friend of mine recommended it and I wish I knew about this sooner.  The wait staff was very friendly and attentive.  The food was delicious.  I was very impressed and will definitely be coming here again.
Jeff and his team do an amazing job.  Excellent food and drinks in a great retro atmosphere.  A great Topeka gem!

name: LongHorn Steakhouse
address: 1915 SW Wanamaker Rd, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews:
Me and my wife came here for the first time today and had an amazing experience! From the time we walked in the door the employees and even manager were so polite and helpful. Our waiter Austin was perfect! There when we needed him! And very polite and respectful. 
Now our food, was just amazing! Came out fast and tasted oh so good. I would definitely recommend coming here.
Food was amazing. They have this dip called surf and surf. I could eat that all say. My boys had steak and potatoes and another side. This location was in kansas. We brought the new years in there.

Great steak salad cooked exactly how I wanted it.  See Matt at the bar is knowledgeable and can make you a drink the way you want it.  He made me a tall red beer not too much tomato.  Perfection.  The fillet salad was served with blue cheese really good.  Fast service friendly wait staff even though I came in 40 minutes before close.  The hot rolls are very good would recommend  snagging a few.  I know it is a chain but not all places are equal.   The restrooms are very clean.  Would recommend.

Always a great place to go!! Reasonable prices, clean restaurant & bathrooms and for being a busy evening, we waited only 5 minutes. Food was excellent as were the mixed drinks. We had such a nice waitress (Twila) & she took great care of me and my husband. The evening was great!

Ordered my steak medium rare & got it burnt on the outside, it was hard, crunchy & tough. First time I had been there in 3 years and now I will never go back. A STEAKHOUSE should know how to properly cook a steak. Husbands hamburger was also hard as heck on the outside. Service was great tho!

name: The Pennant
address: 915 S Kansas Ave, Topeka, KS 66612, USA
reviews: My family and I went to The Pennant for a nice family outing. I found the restaurant excellent as did my wife and son. I had the Boy Blue burger and it was by far the best blue cheese burger I’ve ever had. We never get desert but decided to try the Over The Rainbow shake just because we don’t go out like that very often and not only was it big enough to feed a crowd it also tasted amazing. They have an arcade with select classics and some awesome pinball. The place feels like a mom and pop Dave and Busters but with better food and focus more on nostalgia with the arcade. It’s fun to rediscover some classics with the family. The customer service is what takes this place from great to extraordinary. We went to get the cards to play and the machine was down upstairs so we went downstairs to get them and were informed it’s be 15 min or so before we could get cards for the games. We decided to walk dinner off downtown and walked to our car to put our leftovers away. We got back and instead of buying cards the manager handed each of us a loaded card compliments off management for the inconvenience. I was astonished at how well we were taken care of without expecting it at all. We were still willing to pay and he would t hear of it. Keep up the great work y’all! We  ant really enjoy the games but we will be happy to order take out during this tough time. We will also love to visit once this dilemma has passed.

Where to begin, this place was so fun. The restaurant was delicious, the Mac and cheese bites were very fun to try and tasted delicious. The milkshakes came in so many fun flavors! I got the rainbow one, it had an ice-cream cone with ice-cream inside the milkshake!

The arcade was a blast too! About 8 pin ball games, ski ball, and a lot of really cool games to try. They had pac-man, track and field, and so many more!  The games are not free, although a game card is absolutely worth the cost. For $20 I got 100 game credits and each game cost roughly around 2-3 credits. 

My one complaint was the bar. There were a lot of loud, shouting people who had been drinking. Although I understand it is a bar.

I would definitely recommend bringing your friends, teens and adults.

Heard a lot of good things about the Pennant Restaurant in downtown Topeka so I wanted to give it a try for lunch.

Went there with my Brother in Law. Sat at the upstairs bar. Will say the bartender had no emotion and didn't look or act like she wanted to be there. My Brother in Law got a beer I got tea. The guy sitting beside me ordered a Bud Light and the bartender brought him a Bud heavy. 

I ordered the fish and chips my Brother in Law ordered a strawberry salad with grilled chicken on it. The fish and chips came out with a huge batch of fries that were tasty and 4 small pieces of fish that was plenty. The fish had a decent flavor the fries were good. The strawberry salad was said to be good but the chicken was so dry he couldn't eat it. 

All and all it looks like a cool place with arcade games upstairs. It was somewhat busy for lunch so some people must of got good food there or it was convenient for them to eat there. Probably won't go back.

Really enjoyed this place. First time in and it was kinda crowded for a Tuesday night. Nevertheless we were seated right away. Service was excellent and the food was very tasty. Highly recommend the Thai cauliflower. A spicy delight. I had the Nashville Chicken sandwich and it was deliciously juicy and flavorful. The topping choices for the fries were really fun. Creamy jalepeno was very good. Surprised it took us this long to check this place out. Next time we'll enjoy the arcade.:)

It was an okay experience. The company I was with made it better.

Service was slow. Our waitress already had a long day and definitely was not up to taking care of anyone. I feel for her. Perhaps staffing was not good that day either. 

It was my first time there. I loved the alcohol shakes but the atmosphere left something to be desired.

Maybe next time we are in town things will be different but for now it's meh outing. For service and atmosphere.

name: Blue Moose
address: 3030 SW Wanamaker Dr, Topeka, KS 66614, USA
reviews: Service was very good.  Waitress mistakenly dropped my food while delivering table order.  Remade but delayed.  She told the truth.  She and manager both apologized and some discount fof the delay.   It was not necessary but was nice.  Food was very good.  Waitress was great.

Didn't order from their menu, chose the brunch buffet instead. It had a good variety of both breakfast and lunch to chose from. My favorite was the cold smoked salmon, fresh fruit, Eggs Benedict and Mirmosas!! We had good service and enjoyed the formal but relaxed atmosphere.

A lot of energy in this place. High volume of cross table conversations thoroughout the place. Very friendly waiting staff. Good happy hour drinks. The shrimp wontons are to die for! The mini cheesecake needs something else.... The build your own mac and cheese is everything!

Went for lunch on a Saturday afternoon and was highly impressed! Not busy, so we were seated right away. Server was very attentive and service was quick from beginning to end. I had a hard time deciding between two different entrees, and the waiter recommended the buffalo chicken wrap, and I was not disappointed at all! So good! Just enough spice, the chicken was tasty and crispy, and it was just all around excellent! Atmosphere is nice and upscale, but not over the top. I would confidently recommend the Blue Moose to anyone looking for a great meal!

We came in from out of town and this place was amazing. The service was quick, polite, and friendly. We got  The Mac and cheese with white truffle oil which was the best I’ve ever had! No exaggeration! We also got a wedge salad which was delicious! It was also reasonably priced! Overall amazing experience, highly recommended!

name: Paisano's Ristorante
address: 4043 SW 10th Ave, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: Locally owned restaurant, with far more authentic southern Italian fare than the popular chains.  Consistently good service and outstanding food.  Some seating us not the mist comfortable, but the atmosphere is fine.  A bit more expensive than other Topeka shops, but we'll worth the money.  Always a stop considered when we are in Topeka.
Love, love the food. Very nice place to wine & dine. Very polite staff. Food options are great to have veg and non veg italian food.

Everything Italian!!  The food is very good. Our waitress was fantastic.  She was helpful, knowledgeable, and unobtrusive. (That is a strong combination of skills.) I found it would be good to get there before 11:30 for lunch - go and ask them why! My tomato sauce was cooked down a little too much Very thick, but very tasty. Of course I will return.  So will you!

The atmosphere was perfect. Frank Sinatra played on the speakers as we walked in. I was finally here. My first time at the location in Topeka, I had them years before but in Lawrence and my taste buds were not as they are now. We were seated within minutes. There were a couple of people in the restaurant, not too cluttered, restaurant kind of small, but gives it a cozy feel, the lighting was great, we were seated at a table, within two minutes our waiter was spot on with asking what we wanted to drink. I got Pepsi he got Mountain Dew, then he asked what we wanted to order not skipping a beat, the gentleman really was a pro, I ordered the amazing Garlic Cheese Bread and the Chicken Parmaigiana
$14.99, and my friend ordered the Roman Twins,  the plates were massive. I couldn't even finish mine.. And I m still so stuffed I can barely think to write this review... All in all.. Everything was perfect, except the sauce I felt was a little sweet... Only reason for the 4 and not 5 stars... One of my best Labor Day memories though...thanks Paisano's for making me feel right at home.... You did a great job

Let me first say that I have been a fan of Paisano's for years, which is why it pains me to write this review. My husband and I took our son here as a treat before my upcoming deployment, and we both feel that the service and quality of food has diminished. Service was incredibly slow and our waitress seemed overwhelmed with her three tables. My pasta sauce was listed as a garlic and olive oil sauce with balsamic vinegar and there was no balsamic, nothing but oil (see picture). Sonsad to see a place we love lose quality.

name: Texas Roadhouse
address: 5901 SW Huntoon St, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: Exactly what your expecting from a Texas Roadhouse. It's loud. They have meat. Sometimes the servers dance unenthusiastically to whatever is popular on country music stations. Bartender was friendly and had clearly been doing it for a while as she knew what she was doing and her guests knew her.

Served 2 well done steaks in a row, I ordered med rare. No manager talked to me, never fixed the problem. Just comped it and left me with cold fries and apple sauce for dinner, pretended like I didn't ever order a steak for dinner. Great bar service though minus the second steak sitting in front of me the entire time, and no correction ever replaced it. Poor expo, grill cook, and manager performance. Very very poor :/
This has always been my favorite place bit I tried the ribs for the first time and they were dry as dust.  Taste was great but too dry.  Everything else was fantastic

Wanted to help a business in a difficult time. I was very disappointed. I did the online order with curbside pick up for a family of 6. When we got our food home we were missing 1 whole meal, the side for another, and the 3 chicken fried steaks were all chicken fried chicken. Come on guys you really need to up your game. Was looking to have a nice sit down with the family but instead will be in the car for the next hour and was just told the chicken fried steaks were sold out. You have my phone number you could have saved us both some time.

I called 1 hour before we got there to be added to the phone que. When we arrived we only waited 5 min for our table. The food was exceptional, and the service was beyond. The atmosphere was like a dream, and the experience was the best I've had in years. Thank you for everything!!!

name: Globe Indian Cuisine
address: 117 SE 10th Ave, Topeka, KS 66612, USA
reviews: The Globe was even better than I had remembered!! Got take out and it was so delicious and got so much food!! The staff were very awesome too; they were so friendly, hardworking, and helpful. If you love Indian food like I do then come give them a visit, you won't be disappointed 🙂!!
The whole fish was outstanding. Very nice service and delicious accompaniments. Will go again when I'm Topeka. Nice glass fixtures that appear to be blown.

Visited Globe's lunch buffet again.  I have eaten lunch there for over 20 years, frequently back when I worked within walking distance and still as often as I can.  I have never visited for dinner though.  They always have a nice selection for lunch. The quality of the food is excellent and they cook it as it should be with lots of spice!  If you love Indian cuisine, treat yourself!  I highly recommend Globe.  The only drawback is, which is on me, is I always eat too much trying to try a bit of everything!

We ordered out somewhere new to us tonight and were absolutely NOT disappointed. We ordered Tandoori Shrimp, and Shrimp Biryani. Masala Chai Tea for the drink. It was ALL fantastically amazing. We will absolutely be going back. Thank You Globe for the amazing food!

It is not for me.I won't be back there to eat but the people who work there are so nice, they get 5 stars! They make me want to come in just to visit with them. They are very friendly, funny, welcoming, outgoing, and they interact with their customers. I'm glad I went,even if I didn't have any lunch. 🤷🏾‍♀️

name: Chez Yasu
address: 2701 SW 17th St B, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: Always upgrade your salad for the goat cheese salad. They are always featuring something new to try. Enjoy some wine and be sure to save room for dessert! Great service and staff. Making reservations is easy! Check it out.

Soooooo went with wife for anniversary and she loved it I enjoyed it but wasn't blown away after we left not gonna I went to the taco shop across the street to get me something that would hit on my taste buds

A jewel! If you prefer upscale dining with a cozy atmosphere without upmarket prices make Chez Yasu your restaurant of choice. Everyone says to order the butternut squash soup. The best! Goat cheese salad was laid perfectly and the shrimp with a nice tangy butter sauce were paired nicely. I will be back to sample more from a Chef who has talent.
Oh my goodness, it was a culinary delight. I  loved the different flavors
Loved my seafood crepe, the atmosphere, and the service!

name: Henry's BBQ Grill in Historic Harley Davidson, Topeka
address: 2047 SW Topeka Blvd, Topeka, KS 66612, USA
reviews: There really needs to be a big sign outside. I almost didn’t stop in and that would of been a mistake! Very good Q at a reasonable price! Great sauce that’s sweet with a little tang. I can’t wait to go back and try more items!

Welcoming friendly service, ordered pulled pork and tips, amazing beans (bacon, sausage and beer recipe) and special slaw. I added some spicy BBQ sauce.

Plenty of seats available during Saturday lunch, staff came round to check if food is ok, despite being a fast-food ordering and collection system. I was aiming for the baby back ribs, but only available on Fridays! Hope to be back...
Excellent food! Exceptional staff! Best cheesy bacon macaroni in town!
Great down home bbq cooking. Friendly and fun staff.
Great service, great atmosphere, great food!

name: Bobo's Drive In
address: 2300 SW 10th Ave, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: Neat old vintage drive in cafe.   I wish I lived closer, I would eat here more often.   Everyone seemed really happy to be there working.   Food was quick and good. Great experience overall.

Came to try out the famous Bobo Drive In. I was immediately greated when I pulled up. Waitress was friendly. I ordered a simple cheeseburger and fries. The cheeseburger was tasty. A bit crunchy at the edges. The fries were fresh and they gave me quite a bit of them. Only a little over $5, so not bad on pricing. I'll probably be back again some time. Quality food at a good price.
I love the pork tender & onion rings. Awesome! My family love the double steakburgers with cheese. Carhops are prompt, knowledgeable, & friendly. 4.5 for me also.
Hands down best onion rings I’ve ever had! Burgers were delicious! The chicken fingers are huge! My fiancé said the chili cheese fries were the best he has ever had! Will be coming back!!

Just what you would expect from a classic diner. A cheeseburger that reminds you that some food is meant to be enjoyed. The onion rings were perfect, and the chocolate shake was thick and creamy. And prices that should make fast food chains ashamed. Well done BoBo's... That's how you become a classic.

name: HuHot Mongolian Grill
address: 5900 SW Huntoon St, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: How was HuHot Mongolian Grill? Wonderful! It was really wonderful. My wife and I stopped by on a whim as we were traveling through, we were so glad we did.  The food was amazing.  Prices were great. Service wonderful (although maybe slightly under staffed). The manager was one of the best restaurant managers I have seen, and it is reflected in all other parts of this HuHot location.  We'll be making it a point to travel through here more often just so we can enjoy some more HuHot!

It has been about 10 years since I have been to a HuHot Mongolian Grill. I found the Topeka one to be clean, friendly, and quick to serve. I was a little discouraged with the diluted nature of the garlic oils in the sauces. I felt I placed a significant amount of “sauces” on the entree but after it was cooked, to the food was rather bland. I was looking for a strong garlic flavor with 9-10 ladles of Garlic oil.
The selection was fantastic on the bars from the meats to the veggies to the final toppings. Our server was amazing, always smiling and came to the table at just the right timing. The grill master was a blast and engaged the customers which I feel gives it a personal touch. Finally if you are practicing any of the various eating lifestyles, this HuHot caters to many of them i.e. Keto, Atkins, Weight watchers, etc. I would definitely recommend this place just make sure you really “load up” on the oils/sauces.
Great food cooked on a grill right in front of you. You pick your own meats and veggies in a bowl and add sauces. Then take it to the grill. Tastes gr8!

Fresh ingredients, fresh veggies, fresh oils and sauces to try. It is also vegetarian friendly or for those trying to stay on a keto diet. 
I always get great service here and leave happy and full.
I had never been to a HuHot before. I LOVED it!!! Can't wait to go back!

name: Cracker Barrel Old Country Store
address: 1421 S West, SW Ashworth Pl, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: Good service. The food was as ordered and warm. The server was a very nice. We got seated quickly. We will sure return.

They forgot my steak fries, so the manager took care of me for having to drive all the way back across town. 10/10, best customer service I have EVER received. Food is amazing, I love the catfish and chicken and dumplings, to the manager there, thank you for your kindness!

I’ve ordered the meatloaf dinner to-go 4-5 times during covid. Only once has all of the food been hot. Picked up a meal today, the only thing hot were the green beans. If I didn’t like the meat loaf so well, I wouldn’t return for to-go food.
The food and ambience warm you from the inside out! The store is filled with delightful items that remind me of my childhood. We've had better service but will definitely go again.

Absolutely beautiful in this restaurant/ store. Bathrooms very clean, well stocked with hand soap and paper towels. Great supply of items to buy in the store part, inside the restaurant very intimate! Wait staff extremely kind and willing to help! Food orders taken immediately,  drinks served promptly, and when food was served it was nice and hot!
Definitely will be returning with my family to enjoy another evening out. Thank you.

name: Pad Restaurant
address: 1730 NW Topeka Blvd, Topeka, KS 66608, USA
reviews: Like fried food? Like a home town feel? Maybe want a salad? Answer any of those with a yes, then this is the place for you. I have yet to find a cheese fry this good. Love em but the ole ticker/cardio doctor wont approve. Good ice cream also.
Excellent food and great atmosphere.  The double cheeseburger with bacon is excellent.  Fries and chocolate shake was delicious. If you can, go.

One of Topeka's must visits if you are. In the area and hungry.  It's survived many years for a reason.  Fast and fresh should be their motto because you will get a freshly prepared order Everytime you go there and you will come back because the quality is great, the service is friendly and there is even a salad bar if you decide you want to dine in.  They have the best pork fritter in a 100 mile radius.  A definite MUST DO if you don't get here very often!

AS always!!! The Pad is the best place in North Topeka for a meaty and cooked to order Burger!

Troy is doing a wonderful job keeping up the family tradition of quality and wonderful service.
We went once again tonight, Christmas eve, and they did a great job with service and it all tasted great.

name: El Centenario
address: 1306 S Kansas Ave, Topeka, KS 66612, USA
reviews: When I review a restaurant I rarely use the phrase "the best" with that in mind this absolutely is the best authentic Mexican restaurant in Topeka. Always amazing food and service paired with big portions you can't go wrong. Highly recommend the tamales.

This is a good Mexican restaurant in downtown Topeka. The service was fast, and the food hot and tasty. The building is kinda unique, and ads a level of atmosphere. I would recommend this place if you are looking for Mexican in Topeka.
Service was outstanding. 4 wait persons. It only took 5 minutes to get my food. Best tamales I've ever had. I went for lunch and they were fairly busy.

This is a great little Mexican restaurant, as are all of the little restaurants in Topeka.   In my humble opinion, El Centranario has THE best carnitas in this town!  If you like delicious marinated shredded pork that is melt in your mouth tender?  This is the spot to get it.
Love, love, love that place! I have been MANY times, great food, not the same old same old, great service EVERY time!

name: AJ's NY Pizzeria
address: 1930 SW Westport Dr, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: Incredible pizza! Gluten free option at a very reasonable price. Regular slices are HUGE. Pleasant atmosphere, bustling but not frantic. Plenty of seating options and neat decor. Friendly staff, too. Highly recommend!

The employees were very friendly, the menu was impressive, and (best of all) the pizza was delicious! We went with a classic, pepperoni. The cheese had just the right amount of stretch, the pepperonis were nice and crisp, and the crust was perfect. It even had just the right amount of sauce, which was flavorful and not too sweet. The decor on the inside of the restaurant was cute, reminiscent of NYC. We stopped on a whim and left knowing we'd be back!

This place has awesome new york style pizza! We get the chicken parm pie and 2 of us have a hard time refraining from eating the whole thing :D
The crust is fantastic. 
Nice atmosphere and it is well priced for the product.

Tonight my boyfriend and I went to AJ’s for the first time (we are from out of town) and we absolutely loved every moment of our experience here!! Jordan was awesome! He was so kind, friendly, and provided us great service! The pizza was absolutely delicious and the general atmosphere was so cozy and welcoming! We will be coming to AJ’s every time we’re in Topeka! Thank you!

Great experience every time I come in. Staff is super friendly and even when they are busy they are always kind and attentive while you are waiting. Been coming here for years. A great place to hang out or have large group get togethers in the party room. Food is delicious and always hot and fresh out the oven. The bartenders are amazing and can always recommend good drinks. Servers always check up on us even though you order the food at the bar. There are also great drink specials every night of the week.

name: Saigon
address: 3200 SW 29th St, Topeka, KS 66614, USA
reviews: I enjoy the food here but service isn't always the best. They have just enough help. If it's busy, very door service

So lucky to have this Vietnamese cuisine here in Topeka! Spring rolls are the best in town, I think their peanut sauce has to do with that. Their pho is good but I favor discovering their various Vietnamese dishes. Take an adventure and taste something new!

The hours on google are incorrect. They close between lunch and dinner. 

I still haven’t dined here because every time I go, they’re actually closed between meals. 

I would recommend calling first to check to see if they’re open.

Excellent service all around. The owner greeted us and sat us in a timely manner. The food was delicious and very good portions were served. Worth coming back again.I read about this recently and liked the story of how this place came to be. I was excited to finally get a chance to eat there.
I love the environment and the staff is always very pleasant. And the food is amazing.

name: A-Hann Thai
address: 2222 SW Washburn Ave, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: I stopped in for lunch here recently and was very impressed. The Pad Thai was incredible, but the wait staff also highly recommended the drunken noodles.  I thought the lunch price was very reasonable, especially considering both the quality and quantity of the food.  The staff was amazing, and made me feel very welcome.  This is the best Thai place I've been to in the area.  I will certainly be back.

Delicious meal tonight! Delivered right to my car door. Friendly, always flavorful food!!! We ad the Tom Yum Soup, Fresh Garden Rolls, and Pad Cashew Nut (shrimp added) entree. Thank you all so much!!! (My husband said the Fresh Garden Rolls were the best he has ever had!)

Best Pad Thai in town, I’ve tried them all. Always fresh ingredients with everything I’ve ever ordered.  The sweet chili dressing on any salad they have is to die for. The staff is very friendly and extremely appreciative every time I ordered take out during the pandemic. Can’t wait to dine in again.

This is the fourth time I've eaten here and I've tried something new each time and loved it. I had the starter sampler this time and the crab rangoon may be the best I've ever had. I really like their pad Thai and my aunt and uncle are a big fan of their curries. Servers have always been excellent. So glad they've been getting the business they deserve. This is exactly the type of place I love about Topeka.

This cute little Thai restaurant really impressed me. Everything from the potstickers and crab delight, to the fried rice and pad Thai, it was all delicious and very flavorful. I ordered mine hot and it was just the right amount of heat. Nice atmosphere as well! Definitely coming back

name: The Weather Room
address: 920 S Kansas Ave, Topeka, KS 66612, USA
reviews: Great Bar! Sarah is a fantastic bartender who knows how to mix not just crank standard cocktails. Lot of unique twist.  Can't want to come back.

Food was wonderful. Wine was really good. Service was good. Staff was supportive of each other, seamlessly removing used  plates and responding to put rewuests . Our waitstaff, Frank, was just the right amount of attentive. Great atmosphere and decor. We'll be back

Stopped in during Restaurant Week. Mmmm..I would characterize it as upscale casual. A bit noisy. I was dining alone so  didn't have to worry about conversation. You can wear jeans, which I did , like the wait staff or be a bit dressed up. The number of wait staff was confusing at first. Then it was just two primary ones. Overall, the service is good and you should tip accordingly for that. Maybe not so much for the food. The food was cooked to perfection except my main course salmon was waaayyy over seasoned. It was paired with an equally salty side. Main course was kinda like a salt lick. Next time I will request light to no salt and hope for the best. I didn't send back, but was tempted to. Real butter with the hot yeast roll. Noticed I said roll. The meal combinations are interesting. All the courses are just enough for one person.  Which is fine, no leftovers to hang out in my fridge for days. I would give suggest giving them a try. Be prepared for a wee bit of a sticker shock for the quality of the food. It is nice to have a more upscale option to consider.
This was so good! We will definitely be coming back. Stylish atmosphere.
Food and service were both excellent. The prices were fair as well. Highly recommended.

name: Kiku Japanese Steak House
address: 5331 SW 22nd Pl #46, Topeka, KS 66614, USA
reviews:
Wonderful experience with great atmosphere for our group. Chef was great, he interacted wonderfully with all of our group. 

Food and drinks were great, server was attentive and nice.  As expected for a higher price point. I definitely felt like it was worth it. 

Top notch night out with friends and family!

This was my first time here. Our waiter was great and the food was delicious. Our waiter was constantly bringing refills and was on top of checking on my Wife and I. The chef was great and was pretty funny. The show was pretty short and simple but was still cool nonetheless. My only complaint would be the grills and surrounding area was pretty dirty. You could see all the built up grease on the front of the grill. I also saw a lot of old food in the crevices on top of the grill. All in all, the food was good and the service was timely. I would definitely go back again.

One of my whole favorites! We frequent this restaurant all every year for birthdays and special occasions. The food is always amazing! The Drinks , the Mt.Fuji is my all time favorite and sushi is the best I have ever have! I love the rice the veggies they cook in front of you. We get steak and chicken and it never disapoints! Most go!

Today was my first time at Kiku.  Absolutely loved the whole experience.  A bit pricey, but it also comes with a great show.  The chefs cook your food right at the table and put on a great show for you.  Well worth it.  Large portions.  Great drinks.  I will be back!

I've been coming here for years.  I'd give them 5 stars but the chefs do not give the show they used to.  Just a basic egg roll & onion volcano.  I'm ok with bringing my kids here for the price if we get a good show but if they don't improve that will be my last visit. Food was excellent service was ok.

name: Los Magueyes Mexican Food
address: 623 SW 6th Ave, Topeka, KS 66603, USA
reviews: I love their tortas and gorditas! I highly recommend checking them out if you want a quick bite!
Great local food!

We came in at the end of the evening. The food was great. The service was great. The atmosphere was great. They have food and drink specials monday thru friday. Handicap parking and seating. Big parking lot is easily accessable.they serve alcoholic beverages.
Very good and fresh food. I would recommend this place to every one. Definitely a diamond in the rough.
Good service the food is good end the price is right

name: Oriental Express
address: 5954 SW 29th St, Topeka, KS 66614, USA
reviews: I and my wife have been going here to eat for years and have never been disappointed. The menu is great and the cost is very reasonable. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who loves Chinese cuisine. I hope this restaurant will survive this virus that is bringing our great country to its knees. God bless and stay safe.
Generous portions for a great price. Everything was delicious. Very friendly staff too!

How often does a Chinese restaurant give you a side of steamed broccoli with your general Tso's chicken? It may not make up for the fried chicken, but it sure is a refreshing change. Aside from that, I've never had a bad dish or bad service. This place is great.

Great food, even better service. Our two ASD kids are super picky and the staff made sure they got enough  to eat(including giving them extra fortune cookies). Honestly, the best pan-asian food I've had in Topeka!
Chicken pad Thai is amazing and delicious! Quick service and great food. Two can eat lunch for less than $15.

name: Amigos Topeka Mexican Restaurant
address: 5145 SW Topeka Blvd, Topeka, KS 66609, USA
reviews: The best Mexican restaurant in Topeka. Always good service and always a fantastic meal. Take a look at the chilaquiles and tacos al pastor. They were mouth watering and delicious. Definitely worth the trip.
The food was good. The service was good. The waitress was excellent. The only bad thing was took awhile to get refills and all of our food at once.

Waited to be seated. Waited to give our order. Waited 20 minutes for two meals. Waited for take home boxes and ticket. Restaurant was only have full when we arrived. Food was good though. Will give them another try I think.
The beef nachos here are the best I've ever had.
Love this place. Food is amazing and the service is like being home.  So friendly!

name: Hunam Chinese Restaurant
address: 5005 SW 29th St, Topeka, KS 66614, USA
reviews: My family has been coming here for 20 years. The food is great and the owner has been so kind to us. It’s the only restaurant I look forward to visiting when I  visit Topeka.

Lady at front desk is so rude. Beware she is the owner  she answer  the phone hangs up quick. Food is off not great and not bad. There are no  customers  in restaurants . The watries  is kind and nice .
Worst Chinese food I have EVER had. $40 worth of food in the trash. Called to complain. Lady hung up. Will not ever go back
Beautiful restaurant. Very authentic. Great place for Date Night!
This place is pretty cool and cheap food that taste great. Old asian lady owned she is super nice. Big portions.

name: Margarita's Jalisco
address: 1616 SW 17th St, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: Great little mexican restaurant across from Washburn University. VEry authentic food. Just got back from Mexico and they have a lot of original dishes that I had there. Try the pan fried taco and the enchiladas in the green chili sauce. Full bar.
Food is awesome! Wasn't a long wait time! Cute place to sit back with family and have a good time!
Good food, good wait staff, and good Margaritas. We like to go there. It is comfortable and fairly close to home.

Poor service, never in my life I had worse service. The waiter focused on the party of people and others and CONSISTENTLY walked by our table. We ordered our food and it looked under cooked, we reordered and didn’t get our food. Don’t recommend this place at all
Outstanding place! Some of the best Mexican food I've ever had! Staff is super friendly. Fantastic visit!

name: Tortilla Jack's Mexican Restaurant
address: 1618 SW Washburn Ave, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews:
This place makes my soul food. If need centering or need to figure out why I'm here on this earth, I come to Tortilla Jack's.

I order the Nacho Platter. It's a "build your own," and comes with their awesome cheese sauce. Then I add: lettuce, tomato, onion and taco meat. That dish sets me straight every time. I love this place❣️🤗

Friendly staff. Fast service. Food was really good. The chili and cheese covered burrito was really good. The taco burger was just like the way Taco Tico used to do back in the day. Very pleased with this outing.
I love the experience at Tortilla Jack's Mexican Restaurant. There tacos are great and at a cheap price. If you want to go somewhere cheap and close by I recommend coming here.

Well, if chips and salsa are your thing you’re gonna want to go here.  There’s an entire buffet set up of just chips and salsas 😍  restaurant was clean, staff friendly, food was good and the restrooms were clean.  I’d recommend

Top favorite places to eat in Topeka. Friendly staff, quick service, amazing food. Don't go here if you're expecting authentic Mexican, but it is still a great place to grab a bite to eat. Highly recommend trying their burracos at least once. I've never found one at any other Mexican place, authentic or not.

name: El Mezcal Restaurant
address: 511 SW Topeka Blvd, Topeka, KS 66603, USA
reviews: Great food, Great Service. Great location. Fresh Food. Better than average accuracy. All around good establishment. A+ in my book! I would recommend to anyone. Cleanliness is exceptional and for the most part food is always delivered fresh and taste great.Great food, Great Service. Great location. Fresh Food. Better than average accuracy. All around good establishment. A+ in my book! I would recommend to anyone. Cleanliness is exceptional and for the most part food is always delivered fresh and taste great.Store was nice and well put together, plenty of stock, knowledgeable staff ,friendly staff, cleanliness of the establishment was a plus, store set up flows well, great location, parking was decent, check out was fairly speedy.

Overall good experience. Quick service with drinks, chips and salsa, and food. Good food that I would describe as standard Mexican. Nothing out of this world, but also nothing terrible (at least not that I had) either. We would return again.

The food is wonderful and a generous meal is honestly cheaper than a fancy burger with fries and soda at a fast food restaurant. The ambience is fun. Most of the wait staff is polite and the service is always fast.
The caldo de pollo is amazing and will make you forget your grandmothers chicken soup. The chimichanga 5 stars as well as the tacos. Dont forget to top it off with a jumbo margarita.
We ordered multiple orders of polo arozes add  12 shrimp to each for 7$ extra. We only received 5 shrimp each!! The guy on the phone told me it would be 12 shrimp 7$  nope we got 5 on all 3 orders!

name: Cook's American Grill
address: 1936 SW Gage Blvd, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: This is a great place to eat. They have a big menu but I always seem to go for the same few things because they are so good. I recommend the cheeseburger and most recently I tried the BLT which was very good. This is a great local place to support. You won't be disappointed.
I had a double bacon cheeseburger, and it was excellent. The wait wasn't especially short or long, but the food was well worth it. I will eat here again when I'm in the area.
A perfect example of a great hole in the wall place. The food is really great and that’s partly because it’s not trying to be anything fancy. I also love the paper cars that the kids meals come in.

Cook's is a great place when you're hungry for some home cooking but don't want to cook. Chicken fried chicken is delicious and the mashed potatoes are really good. Not a lot of atmosphere - order at the counter and get your own drinks and tableware but they do bring your meal to the table if they're not busy. Probably closer to 3.5 stars than 4.
Great food! Lots of pie choices. Very diverse menu. Snd their cinnamon rolls are delicious!

name: LaRocca's Pizza
address: 3100 SW Gage Blvd, Topeka, KS 66614, USA
reviews: When we get tired of the quality at the fast food places, we go to LaRocca's. The pizza here is always next level, but the wings and the pasta dishes are good too. I recommend the BBQ Smokehouse pizza made with smoked brisket, pulled pork and polish sausages from Hermann's Meat Market. They've also got an awesome beer list, so it's a good place to have a cold one and watch the game as well.
I literally love everything I've tried there. The pizza is seriously so good. I could also drink their marinara sauce it's so yummy!

Went for our first time last night, got there and a worker rudely told us to seat ourselves. A few minutes after we sat down and older lady rushed over to us, very rudely tossed our menus down and immediately asked what we wanted. We told her we had never been there before and we would need sometime, she didn't say anything.. just walked off. About 10 minutes later a younger gal came over and took over our table, the rest  of our service was good. The food was great,  but due to the service, we won't be back.

Went here for the first time last Monday, January 20th, 2020, but we will never ever come back. We ordered Deluxe pizza for carry out, got there, took my order. When I got into the car my wife asked me to check our order. We were 100% sure that we got a cheese-flavored pizza. Went back in and told the wait staff about it and this is what she said: "we put cheese in between our stuffing and I'm sure that is not cheese pizza". When we got home, true enough, it was only cheese flavor!!! We were so livid. We spent $20 only for a cheese-flavored pizza. What a ripped off!
Amazing food and the wait staff was equally amazing. I recommend LaRocca's for their bread alone. I had the Pasta Your Way as Spaghetti with Vodka Sauce and Chicken which was great.

name: Kyoto Japanese & Sushi Bar
address: 115 SE 29th St, Topeka, KS 66605, USA
reviews:
Great food. May need to work on the atmosphere a little bit. Love the owners..
Really good 👍 people
Fantastic food. Family owned and operated by great people. Been a favorite of ours for years.

This place is always AWESOME! The owner comes out and takes care of people personally, which is more than I can say for most places. The food is stupendous, the service is always excellent and the atmosphere is quaint and comfortable. Five stars all the way.
This restaurant has some of the best food to offer in Topeka. Its owned by this nice family who greets you as soon as you open the door. Would recommend to anybody.
Great food. Tuna Tataki is outstanding!

name: Wok & Grill
address: 400 SW 29th St suite u, Topeka, KS 66611, USA
reviews: First time trying tonight and I have to say hands down the best Chinese/Japanese restaurant in town. The lady taking orders was super nice and very accommodating. Thank you very much for a much needed pleasant experience!!!!

"Please read all of review!!!" Great food and service!  A lot of food for a great price.  Definitely worth trying out!!! We will return!!!  
Saw the change in hours and wanted to share with ya'll.  One man band shop with kids....  I understand the urgency of changing hours.  Let's ralley behind the owner and show him how much we like what he has to offer!!

This place use to be amazing! Best in town.
Takes for ever to get your food anymore!
The newest thing they have changed the hours again!
With a sign in the window of Temporary Hours
looks like they are only open for dinner on Friday and Saturday’s.
I called for 20 minutes before driving 17 minutes to get here to find a note in the window. CLOSED
They should AT Least have an answering machine that says they are CLOSED! 
Since sitting here writing this, 3 more customers have pulled up to find they are closed!!

This place has weird hours. Just because it says they are open at X time doesn't mean they actually are. Also sometimes the front desk lady is baby sitting as well as working.. which is odd. However, the food is great here. I have never had a bad experience with the food, and a personal recommendation from me would be the steak and fried rice, super tasty!

Great Price, Better Food.  Get the dishes as hot as you would like.  Everything we have had so far has been awesome.  We've gone twice within three days, should say how amazing their food is.  The customer service is amazing.  The place is well lit and clean.  There sweet and sour soup is probably the best in the state.

name: HHB BBQ
address: 906 S Kansas Ave, Topeka, KS 66612, USA
reviews: I found this place while in Topeka on business. I first came with my coworkers for dinner and went back to pick up some bbq to bring home to my family. It's a very relaxed place with plenty of seating for large groups and the staff was super friendly.

Very pleasant and helpful staff. Nice atmosphere. We had the pulled pork nachos, half order of sliders and the Wednesday half chicken special. All the meat was very moist. The chicken was the least smokey but had a good (lemony) flavor. If you like "funeral potatoes" you will love their cheesy taters. The smoked mac n' cheese was really good as well. Looking forward to a chance to go back.

We stopped here on our way through town. Based on recommendations, we got the pulled pork nachos. They were very good. They come with just chips, cheese and pork. Then you can add additional items from a bar.  Made them even better in my opinion that you get to pick how to dress them. We also got the sampler. The best part of the whole thing was the smoked chicken wings. The sausage and brisket were also good.  We ordered sides- cheesy potatoes, smoked mac and cheese, smoked corn and the baked beans. All were solid. My favorite was the potatoes. Good beer selection, friendly service and nice decor make it worth the trip.

The restaurant is well appointed and the menu is simple but perfect. I had the brisket and it was very flavorful and juicy and just fell apart. We also had the pulled pork nachos, which was fun and stupid good. The people were very nice and helpful.

HHB BBQ is everything BBQ should be. I highly recommend the brisket but no matter what you get there you can't go wrong, because their BBQ sauce is divine. Furthermore we got recommendations from the staff which was helpful.

name: Pizagel's Pizza & Bakery
address: 2830 SW Fairlawn Rd, Topeka, KS 66614, USA
reviews: Their bagels are great, but their cream cheese is the best! They have many different flavors to choose from and each one I've had so far is great. My favorite is the vanilla brown sugar, it tastes just like cheesecake filling! Also, the pizza is really good too!
The staff was friendly and helpful. The pizza was very good. I will try to come back.
Just got my order from eat street. Never ate here before. Absolutely delicious. The Apple pie pizza was the best. Hot and delicious. 6 stars if I could.
Pizagel's has a good, homey atmosphere. The bagels are great, the coffee is warm and nice, and the pizza must be fantastic. I highly recommend trying this cute café and supporting their business.

Ordinarily we are very happy with this place. We have been going there since it was only Bagel Express. We actually thought that the staff and food quality had improved over the last 15 years. I stop through there about once a month to get a bag of bagels, with two sides of cream cheese, to take to my office and share. My wife stops there a couple of mornings during the week to grab a bagel for us to share. She will get a chai tea and get me coffee. She did have a bad experience yesterday. It was not with staff. Or the ordering experience. It was with the quality of the bagel and the amount of cream cheese on it. This was the first time we had a problem. I hope it is not an indicator of what is to come.

name: Perkins Restaurant & Bakery
address: 1720 SW Wanamaker Rd, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: I want to thank Perkins once again. For Easter we would always go to your restaurant when my Mom was alive because she loved the sweets. After she passed we could have gone elsewhere but we still came back to Perkins. The food was always great and the service even better. Yesterday on Easter my daughter ordered from there to go in honor of my Mom. She said she was the only car in the parking lot and she could see maybe 3 employees only. She said they were so happy to see her and were so nice in getting her the food she ordered. You see Perkins even in a troubled time you are a beacon of hope. I'm applaud your business and even more your caring staff. I hope to sit inside again someday soon.

The service was amazing the prices were decent and the portions were plentiful. I've never gotten my food so quickly before. It was cooked fresh to order and came out hot and stayed hot! It was flavorful and well seasoned. The atmosphere was quiet yet pleasant. And got service with the smile the entire time. Will most definitely go there again.

Love eating at Perkins. Wonderful food and staff. Great prices and portion sizes. Not so good when young children want to get up and run around though. Need a place for them to get their energy out before and after eating.
First time here!!!! We loved it! Service was excellent, and all the people who worked here were wonderful!

Whenever I want good French toast, this is where go when in Topeka. I got the Brioche platter with sausages and eggs over medium. Very nice. Very comforting. Great coffee, and the bakery is excellent.

name: Topeka Pizza
address: 1630 SW Arvonia Pl, Topeka, KS 66615, USA
reviews: I stopped in here over Christmas to donate toys to the Topeka Mission.  I did not know doing so would earn a free pizza.  We tried the pizza here as a result.  It was very good.  We especially enjoyed the bread sticks and homemade ranch.  The staff are nice and fun to talk to.  We have added Topeka Pizza to our pizza rotation.  We recommend giving them a go.

First off... WOW! This pizza (specifically the buffalo chicken pizza) is UNBEATABLE. I went in for the first time today & took the $7 two slices + a drink for $7 (TAX INCLUDED!) and it was phenomenal.

I doubt I'll order from places like Pizza Hut or Dominos very much going forward; if at all.

Best in town period. There's a lot of places in town that claims to have New York style but this is only one that I've been to plus a really good staff. I would definitely suggest going here if you have the opportunity

Staff were friendly and very quick to get orders in and out to waiting customers. I wish I could say I enjoyed the pizza though. Like a few others have commented, the pizza sauce lacked all flavor. Usually a bump of salt or Parmesan cheese will help, but I did both and nothing helped. Toppings were fair, but for the "higher cost" pizza experience I'm apt to go back to my other favorite place.

This pizza was pretty close to the “real” New York pizza. Let me also say the pizza was HUGE and enough to feed an army. The meat lovers was phenomenal and the seasoning was very good. Only complaint I have is the way the pizza was cut...it bugged my OCD big time. Some large pieces, some smaller ones, way uneven. Other than that, five stars.

name: Los Charros
address: 4111 SW Gage Center Dr, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: Good Mexican food and friendly service. My wife and I frequent when we want a tasty, quick lunch meal. We never leave hungry and the lunch specials are very reasonably priced.
Wow, spicy and tasty, good salsa, a solid meal value!
Friendly staff and delicious food.  Been in a few times because my son loves the kid's taco salad and I've tried different meals each time with no complaints. Reasonably priced as well.
Very good food. This secret seems to be missed by a lot of people. On Sunday's anyway. Good food. Good service.
Enchilada Suiza. Will add more Info later.

name: QDOBA Mexican Eats
address: 1025 SW Wanamaker Rd Suite A, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: Great food, great customer service and great people!!

I love Qdoba!! I always get the 3 cheese nachos with the the chips on the side or a burrito. The chicken and steak are my favorite meats but they also have ground beef and pork. You can build your own I always add the white lime flavored rice pinto beans to mine. Also the medium sauce is on point also known as Verde sauce. The portions are very filling. Their food is fresh and alive with flavor. One of my favorite places to eat for sure.

I have been eating at this Qdoba for years and I never had a complaint! The food is always good. Today my wife got me a bowl and the black beans tasted like it had too much salt in them. When I called to let them know the manager not only replaced my food with a better tasting bowl but he also personally delivered it to my house with coupons for two free entrees. I really appreciate the great service and amazing food this Qdoba has provided our city with! Thank you so much!!!

Went in there about 2 today. The 2 girls and guy were playing hackey sack and tossing a rag around the food and were very rude. Hollering at us don't touch this and that. We left will probably not return. Ball or rag hit in food. Manager needs to address this kind of behaviour. Good luck with your food purchases there

The staff is wonderful. It has been over a year since I moved out of town, but while visiting, I dropped by and was recognized and asked how I'd been. I love the nachos made with all the different ingredients I select.

name: El Mezcal III
address: 5301 SW 21st St, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: I met a relative for lunch here.  Not being from the Topeka area,it was my first time.  The staff was very polite and the service was exceptionally quick from getting drinks to being served our entrees.  The food was good but I wouldn't say it was anything unique.  Maybe getting to explore beyond the lunch menu would be helpful.
Excellent flavor! Fairly priced very clean inside. Highly recommend!

What can I say??? Food tastes almost like Nana's...
Definitely will be eating here again! 
So Delish!!!
Staff extremely kind, and quick! 
Restaurant was very clean and well staffed.
Everyone that works here is extremely friendly and professional.   The food was excellent and nice portion size.  Always a pleasant experience that I will definitely repeat in the future.
Great people great food. Very nice place to go to. Seating is a bit crowded.  Little treats up front. Our server was great

name: EL Chilar Mexican Restaurant
address: 2511 SE California Ave, Topeka, KS 66605, USA
reviews:
My wife and I  decided to try El Chilar tonight and we were not disappointed.
We were greeted  by the owner and he has to rank in the top ten of the nicest guys to run a restaurant and we were quickly seated and brought menus. He asked if this was our first time in and answered our questions about the menu and before we knew it we had fresh chips and Salsa with drinks. He explained the hot and mild salsa and he was visibly pleased by our favorable reactions because both had excellent flavor and the hot (IMO) had just the right amount of heat. There were several items on the menu that I wanted and I was surprised to see that they offered Chili Colorado because not a lot of places offer it. I decided to have the Chili Verde and the wife had the pan fried taco dinner and both were served with beans and rice. Our meals were timed very well and we had just finished our chips and both plates had excellent presentation and the food was hot and very well prepared. The pork in the Chili Verde was perfect and the flavoring was excellent and my wife said that her chicken taco's were excellent also with great flavor and very well prepared.
Business was slow tonight and the owner said that with the snow his business had been slower but this is also a sign to me and when business is slow in a small restaurant and the food is perfectly prepared and has excellent taste this says a lot about the establishment.
My wife and I highly recommend El Chilar and I will have to try the Chili Colorado the next time we are in.
Wonderful food! Doesn't look like much from the outside, but the food was great. Husband and wife own/operate it. My Chili Verde burrito was incredible.

They were a bit short staffed there the cook just had a baby. The fajitas were decent and the taco was ok fell apart though. The enchilada sauce tasted like canned tomato. Knowing it wasn't  the normal chef I'll give it another shot after the normal chef comes back. Will update star rating and review when I do. 

Side note: Owner was nice. He comped the nachos because they forgot to put the meat on them.

This place is awesome.  I had heard good things about it but this was our first experience.  The food and the service we're incredible.  The owners are really great people.  Everyone should give it a try!!!!!!
Very tasty little Mexican diner with authentic dishes.  The entire menu isnt all listed, so bring your smart phone to see the other items.  Very accommodating and excellent service

name: Oriental Pearl
address: 2025 SW Urish Rd, Topeka, KS 66615, USA
reviews: From the outside, I wasn’t sure about this place. When you walk in, you feel welcome in the spacious and relaxing atmosphere. We LOVE the crab rangoons. Prices and service are great too!

This is the best Chinese food restaurant I've found in Topeka.  Sweet and sour chicken was tasty, as well as hot and freshly made.  No weird vegetables or fried things included.  White rice was hot, sticky and fresh.  The decor is nice, but with oddly out of place plastic on tables.  Overall I would recommend.

Food is a little pricey for what you get. Ordered Hunan beef and hot and sour soup. Both had a good flavor to them. But not much in the way of contents. Ive never had cabbage used as a replacement for vegetables as much as this place does.
Flavors were excellent but portions were a bit small for the price.

I ordered sweet n sour Chicken. It was awful!! Dried up fatty chicken with absolutely No vegetables. I called and asked if they forgot the veg and Matt said no, it doesn't come with vegetables.  The rice was greasy and only had dried up but greasy corn. Please save your money. It is the worse Chinese food I've ever had in my life.

name: Iron Rail Brewing
address: 705 S Kansas Ave, Topeka, KS 66603, USA
reviews: What a great lunch today - so glad to be in Topeka and have something open. The food was great - 2 meat deal with beans - black coffee. My waitress was so happy to be working and made lunch fun. Mike Kagay recommends the "engineer" so next time I will try that. Thanks for great service and food.

Once you first step in the atmosphere is what really pops out. I would give 5 stars for the atmosphere.  Hard wood floors great lighting plenty of space between you and the next table.  They even have a room that can accommodate 48 people for private parties. I had the Saison and Kolsch both I would recommend to anyone that does not like a high IBU beer.  My wife had the club and said it was good.  Better than going to subway but not as good as some of the specialty shops.  I had the top city cheese steak, it had great flavor but was soo dry it was hard to eat without sauce. I had their greens and would recommend them over most places in Kansas. They were not overcooked and had a nice flavor. The fried pickles where some of the best I have head.  Crispy outside with a  mellow flavor compared to most I have had.  For the whole family they would not be too spicy for any age.    We will try it again to see if the food is different during peak hours vs mid day. Wait staff was very cordial and could help recommend the perfect food and drink experience for you.

Food was delicious.  Small restaurant in downtown Topeka.  I highly recommend downloading Yelp, they use it for waiting for your table.  There was a large party and our waitress seemed a bit tired up with them frequently.  We had to ask for lemons and other items several times.  Our check was even delivered by another waitress, eventually picked up by our waitress.  The very redeeming qualities was the food, far better than expected.  We do plan to return, we will not have the same waitress.
Big, open, industrial feel. The food was amazing. It took a little longer to get but they were pretty busy when we went. Wait staff was super friendly.

It was a nice place for dinner. The pulled pork ( what I had) was tender and had a good flavor, the drawback was it was quite dry. It is a good thing I like a lot of BBQ sauce. My wife had a salad and said it was good with no drawbacks. As a more bar focused theme this wasn't such a big deal but it was also loud from people talking. They had nothing to soften the sounds. This was our first trip and we do intend to give it another try. Overall the staff was nice, the food did not take too long, but we didn't order anything they had to make on the spot. The prices were par for what you got. I did get the feeling our waitress was a bit busier then the other staff just standing around the bar talking it up. I would like to give 4.5 stars but gave the benefit of the doubt.

name: Hog Wild Pit-Bar-B-Q
address: 5330 SW 21st St, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: We got a family pack. Ordered early and it was great to bring home! The gentleman at the till was really helpful and everyone there was extra polite and thoughtful. We got some extra the next day to supplement our leftovers and were greated by the same kind man again. Yes....go there and enjoy the great food and great service. Thanks!
Best BBQ EVER. I haven't found a better place. Excellent food for a great price. My favorite is the hot links, but the pull pork is great also. Simply the best

You want BBQ? You want good BBQ? You better come here. Out of stater and was looking for a great KC BBQ and found this gem, in the middle of Topeka. Got the 3 meat, and felt like I had to deadlift the plate to my table, there was so much food. And for $12.50? Done. Go here for good food and good value!

Not bad, friendly staff, decent food. I order large portions because i feed a whole crew. This place was able to actually give me the BBQ i needed whereas their competition on Huntoon cant seem to put together enough food for one person, let alone 5 to 8 people. So far Hog Wild has come through for us 10 times whereas the other guys have only been able to do it one time out of 11.
This BBQ place has great food, clean, friendly staff and good prices.. I will be back..

name: Chic-A-Dee Cafe
address: 3036 SE 6th Ave, Topeka, KS 66607, USA
reviews: The food is what you would expect from your typical American dinner.  Freshly made comfort food...yum! The service was outstanding and very welcoming to all.  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars... the atmosphere. It really needs a makeover but just a deep cleaning would help tremendously.

This place was recommended to us by some locals and they didn't lead us wrong. From the outside it almost looks like it used to be a house, but the food is actually quite good. Our server, Carly, was friendly and professional. No complaints at all about her or the food. 

It's a little tight with a wheelchair, but definitely doable.

Small and cozy "grandma's kitchen" type of cafe, made me feel really welcome and at home. Food was a little on the plain side but still delicious and filling as well! Will definitely return and try more of the menu! Decent prices, filling meals and friendly service? What more could I ask for ^~^
Friendly service with great food and friendly pricing.  Sorry about the half-eaten pie, the photo was an afterthought.  Delightful, light and chocolate slice, best I've in a long time.
Delicious every time. Great family place. Always leave with a full belly.

name: El Gallo Mexican Restaurant And Cantina
address: 3501 SW Topeka Blvd, Topeka, KS 66611, USA
reviews: My wife and I needed a place we hadn't eaten before for an impromptu date night. El Gallo it was. Love the food. You get a lot of it, too. We also like the atmosphere.
Excellent food.  Kind staff!  Will be back again!
Every time I've gone the wait staff has been very attentive to our needs without being overbearing. Food is always good and comes out quickly. Reasonably priced as well.
First time visiting. Didn't think the chips and  salsa were the best but ok. The food is awesome, hot and fresh. Employees very friendly. It's very affordable. Must try!
Food came out to our table very fast. Had fajitas they were excellent, salsa was good also. Very reasonably priced.

name: El Ranchito
address: 2800 SW Fairlawn Rd, Topeka, KS 66614, USA
reviews: One of my favorite places to eat hands down. Food is always great. I always tell myself I am going save enough to have lunch for the next day, but I can never keep myself from eating all of it. The service is good and about the same  as every other Mexican restaurant.
This is by far the best place. The waitress is so kind and understanding talks to our children. The food is amazing and the Margaritas are the biggest and best in town!!
The best Mexican place in town!  Excellent food, Great staff! Go early, it fills up by 6PM.

Wow!

I heard this place was owned by a relative of the owner of El Chilar, and making good food runs in the family.  I’m a big fan of two things that usually aren’t found: mole and albondigas.  I didn’t get to try the mole yet, but this big delicious bowl of albondigas was top notch.  It’s a simple meatball soup with carrots and squash, but it’s so delicious.  It’s exactly how family would make it (except they usually put big chunks of potato in it).

I’ll definitely be doing back. I’m 3rd generation Hispanic, and there are certain ways I want my food, and this place met all criteria. 

On my to go places for Mexican in Topeka.
It must be good. Too busy to stay and wait to be seated. Just passing through and didnt want to add pend a long time eating.

name: Gyroville Topeka
address: 2855 SW Wanamaker Rd #4698, Topeka, KS 66614, USA
reviews: I usually order falafel platter. Its tasty and fulfilling. Its a great place to have some good food. And its not costly at all.
Very good food, fast service and fresh ingredients. The menu has many options and most options are on the healthy side. I am very pleased with my experience!

Surprise, its perfect! Nice prices. All the middle eastern flavors you wouldn't expect in a pop up spot. With so many robust flavors in a humble location you will definitely be back for more.
 This is a casual fast food atmosphere. It works well as carryout, just as well as dining in. Note, they have a yogurt bar that presents plenty of options, did not try it.

My wife and I ordered the Philly Gyro and the loaded fries. 
Un.
Be.
Lievable.
Fresh, cooked in front of us, and hospitable service with a smile. Reasonable prices and a very clean restaurant. We will be back!
Disappointed I didn't give this place a try when they first opened! The food is fresh and tasty. A great place to get quick healthy food.

name: Five Guys
address: 1191 SW Wanamaker Rd, Topeka, KS 66604, USA
reviews: Great tasty huge burgers!  If looking for normal size burger, get the Little Hamburger.  Great fries and lots of them! Great service too! Highly recommend for something better than fast food but still fast and fresh!

The burgers are good, the fries are okay. My 4 year old son and I ate there and it cost 25 dollars which is ridiculous. I suggest if you get fries to get the small. Anything else is way too much. It was good but for the cost I will probably go somewhere else if I plan to spend that much.
Good service, faster than I thought, raised their prices. I'd recommend Burger Stand if you have the time to sit down.
I do like their burger and 🍟.
I love Spangles. Staff here is great, food choice is & menu is Amazing, and I even have food intolerance issues! Consistently great.

name: Terry's Bar & Grill
address: 522 SW 6th Ave, Topeka, KS 66603, USA
reviews: This was my favorite spot to eat hot beef and hot turkey sandwiches. They had the best in town for a great price. Went in today and was very disappointed there was hardly any turkey. It was all so small it hardly covered half the box. Extremely disappointed! The entire time I was there receiving my order the waitress was on her phone. I had to wait to be greeted until she finished texting.

Very chill spot, great atmosphere and really good food at a good price! They also have pool tables and plenty of TVs for sporting events. Did I mention .75cent Tacos on Tuesday?! And Sunday as well! Also fried livers and Gizzards are a part of the menu so go check it out!
Very nice and clean. Food is inexpensive and delicious. Offers fantastic bar food appetizers as well as weekly specials. Service was fantastic

Always good times to be had here. $0.75 tacos are better than ones you'd pay more for at the drive thru. Nicole was amazing and the other gals working were fun, too. I always run into good people here. Affordable prices, good food and drinks. Great neighborhood spot.
Long standing local establishment. Terry the owner personally works behind the bar or on the floor as needed.

name: Tacos El Mexicano
address: 2002 SE California Ave, Topeka, KS 66607, USA
reviews: Love the steak and pork street tacos here. You get three to a plate with beans, guac, and fried onions. Best taco plate in town.
Very disappointed!!! Theydid not get my order right. The best thing was the salsa
The food was good small place we took ours home..salsa was excellent
Great experience eating here! The food was very affordable, and quite tasty. The salsa and guac tasted fresh, as did the rest of the food! I would definitely recommend eating here.
So yummy. If you want to try real Mexican food. Here is where to find it

name: Tacos El Sol
address: 2124 SE 6th Ave, Topeka, KS 66607, USA
reviews: The food is okay. It is good to grab a quick bite.  Kind of plain. Customer service is always bad almost. Not friendly. There are other places where the food is the same that I would go to because they have better customer service. The way you treat people goes a long way.
Food is awesome. The meat is really well prepared, seasoned, and cooked. Authentic, delicious, and reasonably priced. Service is always excellent too! They sell so much, everything is always fresh.
